Reviews.Title: “Great Family Get Away”
Reviews.Author: kallakat
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights with family of 4 - large kitchen efficieny room with full kitchen and living area. 2 queen beds and fold out couch with bed. Room was very clean but dated....great oceanfront view! Stayed here several times over the last 30 years and the homemade donuts are stillthe best! Excellent activity schedule with movies on the lawn, indoor and outdoor pools, Tiki Bar for adult beverages too! Would recommend to families- not a posh resort or world class furnishings, but a good cleam family oriented hotel. Location on beach was excellent and is directlya cross the street from a grocery store- very convienent! Ask for Nroth Tower room if you have a small family- having the kitchen will save you money. Don't forget to have the homemade donuts everyday in the office lounge- !

Reviews.Title: “Ocean edge or main road edge?”
Reviews.Author: Andrew D
Reviews.Content: This was early May and the hotel appeared far from full, plus I had booked a month before but I was given a ground floor room only 20 ft from the main road and the only direct daylight was through obscure glass blocks. The door opened out onto the poolside in the indoor atrium so everything smelt of chlorine. There was no mention on the web site of additional charge for ocean facing rooms (or I would have paid it) or any suggestion that i was getting an inferior room. After 5 touring holidays in the States this is one of only 2 Hotels I would NOT revisit. Only good thing the Breakfast diner across the courtyard from reception served an excellent breakfast selection at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “40 years later and still GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: SusieQ22Orlando_FL
Reviews.Content: As a child growing up in Orlando my parents used to take me to Perry's whenever we needed a beach week-end. It has taken me 40 years to bring MY husband and children back to Perry's (mostly because the price always seemed too steep.) Anyway, we just splurged for a 3-night stay over Labor Day and it was every bit as fun as I remember! We had a gorgeous view from our 6th floor South Tower balcony all the way up the beach. Our spacious "kidsuite" room was perfect for us because my husband and I had a king bed, and the kids had their own space (no door, but their own TV!!!) The bathroom was tiny, but the shower and Bath & Body Works soap products were great! On Friday night Perry's showed "Despicable Me" as a "dive-in" movie in the indoor poor area. It was awesome to be able to watch a movie from the pool and hot tub (be aware...the dj announced that it was the last movie night for the season until March 2013.) There were several children's activities offered each day (arts & crafts, bingo, coloring contest, basketball game, etc...) but we didn't try any. We spent each day going back and forth between the pools and beach - it's very convenient that they are so close, and if one pool is too crowded you can try another. The beach here is gorgeous, and although cars are allowed on the beach we didn't have to dodge any to get to the water. I was happy to see there is a lifeguard right on the beach in front of the resort. There is a Tiki Bar serving food and drinks on property right between the pools. One day we ordered lunch (salad $8, BBQ sandwich & fries $6) and smoothies and ate at one of the many umbrella tables all over the grassy property. The food was delicious and it was great not to have to even dry off to get lunch. The resort was full for a holiday week-end, but not packed (except for the parking lots, and the homemade donut breakfast...go early or the donuts will be gone. They were as yummy as I remembered, and saved us from having to bring breakfast food.) There were lots of large, multigenerational families enjoying the week-end, and it could be a little loud by the pools at times, but I bet many of these families had been coming to Perry's for years...everyone was very friendly and having lots of fun. Perry's has lots of character, and that makes it unique and charming, and different from the big chain hotels! Try it, you'll love it, too!

Reviews.Title: “It's just OK...won't be back”
Reviews.Author: jendalessan2
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at some nice places, this place was barely OK. We almost checked out after the first night but decided it was not worth the trouble to find a new place. What we liked: Price Nice staff Location View from our room Kitchen in the room was wonderful! Large balcony Outdoor area was nice for sitting and reading Loved all the plants around the indoor pool! What we didn't like: The place feels old Garbage in the hall the entire time we were there Not deep cleaned-- corners, baseboards, grout-- all visibly dirty Smells in various locations Music by the indoor pool is LOUD and starts at 9:00 in the morning. (Our room bordered this pool) Overall, it felt like the place had seen better days and they have provided minimal cosmetic upgrades to patch when it really needs a complete renovation. It's puttering along and they can squeeze a few more years out of it if they want. We won't be back because when we go on vacation, we want to stay in a newer, nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Our Welcome Back Trip”
Reviews.Author: gadngranny
Reviews.Content: Like many others, we went to Perry's for many years. We had spent the night at a place near the Boardwalk, called our cousins who were at Perry's, said please get us a room down there or we are going home today. Needless to say, they got us that first room and we went with the same cousins for many years, until about 15 years ago when we lost our husbands. This year, we finally returned, and were welcomed like old friends. There have been a few changes, or improvements, but the heart of the place is the same. We plan to return with our kids, who are now grown and have their own families, and sit out back at a table and remember the wonderful times we spent here!

Reviews.Title: “One Of My Favorite Places to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: leitrimtraveler
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Perry's every year since living in Florida and have always had a great time. Our Ocean front room can not be beat with a lovely balcony overlooking the ocean so needless to say we could not ask for any more! All was great and highly and I highly recommend Perry's!

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite places on earth”
Reviews.Author: Sassy718
Reviews.Content: I've visited Perry's Ocean Edge Resort for over 50 years! If you want a fancy smancy place--Perry's is not for you! But. . . if you want an old Florida type place to stay that you'll feel at home in, this is it. I almost hate to tell everyone about it, afraid that it will be overrun with people! Perry's is comprised of four types of accommodations: The original two-story motel/hotel is located in the center of the property with about 1/3 of the units being oceanfront. The other 2/3 are garden front. All in that building face a beautiful indoor pool surrounded by trees and plants and also a huge jacuzzi. That's the oldest building, but still very nice. The next building built was the six- or seven-story South tower. All of those rooms are oceanfront and have a resort kitchen. Or you can pay a little extra and get a room with a full kitchen, or a children's bunk room or a spa room. There's a second pool (outdoor) just off the balcony of those rooms. Then, the newest building is the North tower. It's also six or seven stores and all oceanfront. All of those rooms have kitchens included with another pool just outside your door. There are also some cottages just north of the North tower for people with pets. They're cute and nice, but you can't open the windows, so I don't stay in them. They offer children's programs in the summer and other things all year round, like water aerobics or bingo or various other crafts and activities. There's a Tiki Bar on the beautiful lawn and a breakfast/lunch place on the property also. But you must try the homemade donuts every day in the lounge. It's not a place for swinging singles, but a great place for families or couples or even singles just wanting to appreciate the beautiful ocean. Just step out onto your balcony or patio or sit at one of the many tables on the wonderful lawn and you'll think you're in heaven! Did I mention that I love this place? Can't wait to go back in October (my 5th time this year). Hey, some people stay there for months and one lady has been living there for about 10 years! Much better than a nursing home:)

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place to stay in Daytona.”
Reviews.Author: clydiemae
Reviews.Content: Been going there for 12 years. Love it. Great place for families. Good location, friendly staff, very nice rooms, good value. The fresh made donuts are always a treat. Never once been disappointed when we have stayed at Perry's.

Reviews.Title: “Best Family Vacation Year after Year”
Reviews.Author: Nate W
Reviews.Content: Our family loves Perry's! My wife and I have been coming for over 17 years, and her family has been coming since she was 12. We have 4 children and they love going as much as we do. They would rather go to Perry's than Disney World, so we try to go at least twice a year. We really like the family atmosphere and all the activities that are there. There's a basketball court facing the ocean, a volleyball court and the kids love to play on the shuffleboard courts. They have a great indoor pool with a jacuzzi and 2 outdoor pools which is great if you hate crowded pools and want some variety. We also look forward to the homemade donuts. It's another thing that sets Perry's apart from every other hotel. The Perrycation package is something to look into. We find that it's a great deal because you get dinner tickets for restaurants and also 1pm checkout. This place is definitely for someone who likes nostalgic warm family places to stay. - Nate W

Reviews.Title: “An Average Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shirley D
Reviews.Content: The pools and the rooms (especially the kitchen) were very clean. However the beds for the resort select room were pretty small (full sized), the indoor pools weren't as clean as the outside pools. The breakfast was terrible there were only greasy doughnuts and to drink there was OJ, coffee and tea. The deck area where the outside pools are located were very clean and had a great view of the beach, there was also a shuffle board and mini golf area. The location was great because to compensate for the terrible breakfast there was an IHOP and a grocery store right in front of the hotel. I think it was a little over priced though because even though the rooms were nice and clean it wasn't worth the price. Also the equipment in the fitness room was very old.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay as usual”
Reviews.Author: UFgator7744
Reviews.Content: I have been a customer at Perry's in the past and it still lived up to my expectations. To be an older facility, it is very clean and the empolyees are very hospitable. I had friends who made a reservation for one night while my family was there and the inquired when making their reservation if they could get a room close to ours. Low and behold when they checked in they had the connecting room to ours. How hospitable is that? Check in and check out were done in a timely manner unlike some other places I have stayed in Daytona. The pool area is very nice and peaceful. There are always enough tables with umbrellas and loungers to where you don't have to scurry to beat someone to them as I have also found in other places. Our oceanfront room was great with 2 queen beds, pull out couch and full kitchen. Lastly, the complimentary homemade donuts daily are still awesome. A definite Perry's trademark. Our stay was very relaxing and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: MKC18
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights in late July and had a great time. I have stayed here many times over the years and always enjoyed the resort and surrounding area. This time I did notice the housekeeping staff did not clean the room to my expectations. It appeared they were in a hurry and rushed through the job. The 2 outdoor pools and the 1 indoor is a major plus for the resort especially when the summer rains begin and your forced off the beach. I will definetly stay at the resort in the future. The resort is well maintained and in the process of major upgrades.

Reviews.Title: “This place gets better everytime we go”
Reviews.Author: CJ14006
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, affordable and friendly staffed resort then you need to stay at Perry's. My family and I stayed there back in June and we are making this October vacation plans that include Perry's Resort. The location is close to perfect for all the activities and excitement of Daytona and they are right on the beach and on the quiet side and not all the wild kids. The Spa and the pools are perfect and the donuts in the morning are the best and homemade. My kids love this place more and more evertime we go. They also just renovated the place with new mattresses. There is plenty of parking and winn dixie across the street so saving a buck is a plus staying here. The rooms also have a full kitchen with utensils and pans. You can't beat the price staying here.

Reviews.Title: “I wish we would have checked a couple other places first.”
Reviews.Author: keithsnumber2
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night with family in order to find a place where we would be comfortable staying a few days in July. Not horrible, however, not great either. Should be considered a value hotel and not a resort. Also, for the price we paid, we could have had a newer room/ hotel at a fraction of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach stay”
Reviews.Author: GoneFishin66
Reviews.Content: Planned last minute weekend getaway and booked a room at Perry's. Large room, great pool area with places on lawn to grill out and lounge. We didn't use the lawn area but tons of others did! Beach location was ideal with lots of restaurants and nightlife nearby. Will return!

Reviews.Title: “New Perry's Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: It started with the new front desk personnel being friendly and very helpful. New beds installed (very comfortable) and the facility very clean. They had movies on the lawn Thursday night and the Daytona race Saturday night for the Perry's guest on a large Big Screen TV (fantastic). I met the new manager Rick and he is very customer focused and friendly. This was my 28th year at Perry's and it is still one of my children's favorite trips a year they say we have to do. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends. Mike Hill

Reviews.Title: “Had a great family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: tonibriley
Reviews.Content: This resort is perfect for family vacation. I was happy to have my grandkids and my kids all in the same place at the same time. Reservations were easy to make and when we arrived, everything was ready for us with rooms next to each other. We had a beautiful ocean front view and balcony. Everything was clean and there was plenty of room for everyone. The indoor pool and hot tub is located in a beautiful atrium and we spent time there when we got rained out from the beach. Even did some water aerobics with a great instructor to get our day started. The only thing we didn't like was the music they played at the tiki bar - could have been more upbeat. I will definitely stay here again - prices seemed a little high but reasonable for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Sashibeak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right on the beach front which is lovely. Our room worked really well for us. We had a great ocean view and there was a separate little area with bunk beds for our 5 year old. The hotel looked a little “tired”. I think they are slowly working on renovating and decorating and it certainly needs it. The rooms need redoing and they need some new loungers by the indoor pool. In fact the whole indoor pool area needed revamping to be honest. The hotel was clean though and had everything we needed. The outdoor pools were nice and there was a Tiki Bar (we never tried it) and areas for shuffle board and mini-golf.

Reviews.Title: “Very surprised !!”
Reviews.Author: dockdork
Reviews.Content: This was our first time there ,and true to your reviews . It was discribed as an older hotel and it was, but the grounds and rooms were so clean and well maintained that the small things ,that are out of someones control did not matter. my family absolutley loved perrys! we had one bump .. our kids suite that we originally booked was not ready when they said it was, and we were disappoineted with the view , we mostly saw a corner of a building and some ocean ,the front desk clerk (shawn) i think fixed the problem we were asked to move to the north tower and shown the room in minutes we liked it more and very very satified WE WILL GO BACK !! close to store and resuraunts , and the dounuts were great !!! best manicured lawn, resort area we have ever been to !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perrys used to be better”
Reviews.Author: pandapoo
Reviews.Content: 5 star check in 5 star location 3 star room 3 star bed 4 star landscaping Had a poor stay even checked out early. So many people drunk and screaming, cops even came and evicted the people next to us for domestic violence. I used to come here in the 90s and it seemed more family oriented, the property has declined based on my experience. Will stick to the shores down the street

Reviews.Title: “Another FANTASTIC week at Perry's!”
Reviews.Author: sasong1
Reviews.Content: Just got home today (06/16/2012) from another flawless trip to Perry's!!! We already miss it... They put in new mattresses and box springs, painted the facility, new pool loungers... Wow,... Perry's is our FAMILY favorite resort. They have great ocean front rooms that are clean and comfortable, 3 pools, Tiki Bar, restaurant, gift shop, so many amenities and the staff is exceptional! If you want a wonderful, relaxing time and a great resort, you MUST give Perry's a try!! We are already planning next year's visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best swimming adventure”
Reviews.Author: TrixieTraveler1007
Reviews.Content: We were jumping in the waves when we saw a fin. Heart dropped into our stomach until we saw it jump and realized it was a dolphin. What a rush! The indoor pool was fantastic, room was very welcoming and staff friendly like back home! We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “1st timers...we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: lid535535
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days with my husband and I and our 10 yr old son. We loved it. The location....wow! NO CROWDS! It was wonderful! All you saw was beach, all day long! The pool, fantastic! The staff here, was cleaning the pool, making repairs, trimming the lawn, they were very attentive to making sure everything was well kept and clean. All we ever ran across was friendly people. Our room was a kids suite, very big. My son loved having his own room with bunkbeds. We had a fridge, microwave, stove, toaster, plates, etc. all the amenities of home. There is a small detached restaurant in the parking lot. We didn't eat there. We did the home-made do-nut thing one day, it was okay, but we wanted more, so we went across the street to the Winn-Dixie and bought stuff for lunch and breakfast to keep in the fridge. They have 3 pools here. 2 outside, 1 indoors. It rained on us a couple of times, so we went to the indoor pool, that was nice, it had a retractable ceiling! We had drinks at the Tiki bar, very nice bartender, the view, to die for. It was relaxing, the surf was great. We boogie boarded for the first time, and loved it. We went para-sailing at the place across from the lighthouse (climbed that too). It was awesome. Only regret is that we didn't go 2,000 ft! This isn't a 5 star place, but I would definitely be back. We drove on the beach and looked at other places...this would be the only place I would want to stay.....I know it was just bought by new owners and they are making some needed repairs. Our favorite restaurants that were recommended to us by locals were, The Brickyard (recommended for Best Burger), Crabby Joe's, and DJ's under the dock, next to King's Seafood. None disappointed us. Not cheap, but good. No seafood is cheap. :)

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will be staying here next year.”
Reviews.Author: Lcloud404
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice during the past two years each time for a about a week long stay. I love the tiki bar and the fact that winn Dixie is right across the street. Everything is pretty clean the only issue I have had was getting the door to close all the way, you almost had to slam it every time. Overall it was a nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Staying 37 Years and Counting”
Reviews.Author: bn23
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Perry's for 37+ years and have enjoyed every minute. The hotel is now under new management and there are improvements going on daily. The staff is more than helpful and they go above and beyond to make you feel at home. For a great way to start the day meet Jac for homemade doughnuts, coffee and juice every morning from 7-10:00. There are activities for young and old throughout the day. Be sure and play bingo and tiedye a Perry's t-shirt while you are here. Play shuffleboard and relax at one of the 3 pools (2 outdoor and one heated indoor) or large hot tub. Perry's is a great place for famlies of all ages. So when in Daytona Beach make Perry's your home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “on the upswing”
Reviews.Author: jimkinney
Reviews.Content: we've been going here for 26 years.it was family owned for much of that time until the year they had 4 hurricanes,they were fixing the damage from one of them when another came through.they cancelled our reservations for fall of 2005? and we stayed next door at the El Caribe where they assured us that things were fine,that was fine on the bottom 2 floors but the 3 or 4 floors above them had their ceiling on the floors(water damage from the roof).A most interesting 2 week stay,it gave a good chance to see the damage in the area first hand and watch them work on Perry's.They had to have financing come in the fix the rest of the damage and so became a minority partner.They pretty much milked the place for all they could get out and Pacifica(who have Marriots and Hiltons)have taken over ownership and will bring it back to it's former glory.We just came home from a 17 day stay and they(who have only owned it for two weeks)have already poured alot of cash into it.We'll be going back in the fall and hope to be pleasantly surprised.We talked to Rick who is the new manager and were impressed with his ideas.The staff who we've come to know are all 1st rate.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best oceanfront places to stay in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Scamp2011
Reviews.Content: This is a older oceanfront property, but a lot of propities are old in Daytona. The main thing is that it's clean and comfortable. The staff is also very helpful. The grounds are very nice which, can't be said for a lot of the new hotels. They have a very nice heated indoor pool, but I would prefer to be at one of the outdoor pools, but since neither are heated, no one uses them, even in April, so as a parent of young children you're stuck inside on a beautiful day! I heard while we were there, that this hotel now has new owners. The one thing I would suggest to the new owners would be, make one outdoor pool HEATED and even add a waterslide to that pool, and I guarantee, you would take busniess away from the Sun Viking which is just a motel with a waterslide. I will be following Perry's for next year's vacation and I would love to see my updates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant, like for the last 20 yrs”
Reviews.Author: bob k
Reviews.Content: Just a super nice place to stay, clean as a pin, and a perfect location on the beach front.Excellant ammenities and a Tiki-bar. I have been coming for over 20 years noe, have tryed a few orthers and always come back to PERRYS

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Oceanside Resort in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: JAmmann
Reviews.Content: Living in Florida affords us the opportunity to visit Daytona frequently. Over the years I have stayed at many different places along the Atlantic. Not only is Daytona my absolute preference, but Perry's is the only place I will stay anymore. I have tried smaller lodges like the Viking and larger resorts like the Hilton and the Wyndham. Each of them offered up some issue or some sort of sacrifice. You won't get that at Perry's! The view is fantastic...the location can't be beat..the staff goes above and beyond to make sure your needs are met and did I mention the donuts? YUM! My advice is simple: if you have an opportunity to visit Daytona, make your stay memorable- stay at Perry's...you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Spring break at Perry's”
Reviews.Author: Javisdad
Reviews.Content: My wife's family has been going to Perry's for decades, so I was excited to join the family tradition by taking the trek to Daytona over spring break. We took our tween sons and had a blast. Perry's has the beach, two outdoor pools, and an indoor pool. Lots of internet coverage and the bartender in the Tiki bar (Dean) makes great drinks. Everyone was friendly and it was very laid back. Unfortunately the room service was also laid back! Loved it and will be back to join the tradition.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westorlando
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Perry's several times. For a Daytona Beach hotel, it is nice. Most hotels in Daytona are older and not luxury properties. We enjoyed the relaxed atmosphere. Employees were friendly and our kids loved the donuts! Nice hotel. Not the cleanest, but as I said for a Daytona Beach hotel, it is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice basic motel with nice grounds. Avoid the cafe”
Reviews.Author: pauleaston
Reviews.Content: Perrys is huge, taking up about three city blocks. The staff re great and patient with daft foreigners asking daft questions. Our first floor room faced the highway which is not too busy at night, being a couple of miles south of the busy Broadwalk district so we had a good nights sleep. The room was clean, fresh and well appointed. The place has huge private grounds with lots of chairs and loungers around the pool and big open spaces for kids to play. The outdoor pool gives straight onto the beach which is a big, wind-blown strand with nothing between you and Ireland. Bizarrely they have a road on the beach where people drive about in their cars. We stayed in the nice grounds. The only down side was breakfast in Perrys Cafe. My two eggs easy over, hash browns and bacon looked fab when it arrived. Five minutes later the pig grease it was cooked in was starting to congeal. By this time it was on my hands, around my mouth and I felt a little sick. There is a good iHop over the road. Ask for Gloria. She is lovely and I think she had the hots for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean front rooms for Daytona”
Reviews.Author: magsmey1
Reviews.Content: These rooms are typical beach front rooms. If you are looking for a 5 star place...then go to a 5 star place. The rooms were clean and the carpets were clean enough for a BEACH room. The service was extremely friendly and check in/out a breeze. Grounds were very clean and plenty of seating available. Ask for oceanfront room in South Tower. Amazing views, great sunrises with homemade donuts and coffee from your room. We will continue to stay here when visiting Daytona Beach! Thanks for a wonderful stay...again.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps "hotwire rooms are the older ones"”
Reviews.Author: TravelTravelCanada
Reviews.Content: We booked one night through hotwire as we came in town and found "bikeweek" was moved to the spribg break week. I found the room in a old block of buildings on the far left of the property, right out front and our bedroom wall was against a very busy, a1a and laundry room.It was damp and musty. we had to hold the fridge door closed with a chair. The carpets were dirty. The airconditioner was new but gave a bad smell. We were only here one nuggt so sucked it up. the beach front location is wonderful, the grounds perfect and clean. All pools fantastic. We did use a indoor pool but the kids were a little sad seeing a very ill woman who must be a long term resident looking out the large room windows over the pool. She was on oxygen and her room decorated to her tadte obviously a resident. We did pass by some empty rooms? Large, new flat screens with luving and dinning areas. I would pay anything if offered. We hotwired because there was no vcancies in town, perhaps thats why we got what we got. we got up early, checked out drove back to Orlando and into the Westin Imagine 5 star, great room and Hotwired! and for less than the one niggt at Perrys. I hope the trend stops to use different rooms! We travel a lot so do see it happen. However with this economy I see more resorts bending over backwards no matter what.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Krystal R
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many hotels at Daytona Beach & this is my favorite. Huge property and very family oriented. Multiple pools including a lovely indoor garden area heated pool and large jacuzzi, beachfront property, shuffle board, mini golf, and a tiki bar features to name a few. Fun night atmosphere on Friday & Saturday nights with a DJ at the bar. Rooms are clean and spacious. Very friendly staff! Highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “This place is great for families”
Reviews.Author: CJ14006
Reviews.Content: Great place and kids love it... They have an indoor pool and in the morning homemade donuts. The hotel is right on the beach with winks Dixie across the street and IHOP. Great rates and very clean and down to earth.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay when the price is right”
Reviews.Author: yarijavi
Reviews.Content: hotel staff great the restaurant on property excellent was an all around good stay

Reviews.Title: “old and mucky”
Reviews.Author: Stefy211
Reviews.Content: When we first arrived our reservation was not in the computer. They quickly managed to give us a room but it was not what we wanted based on our booking request. We had to change other two rooms to find one that was fitting us even though it smell like a humid room with no AC. It was at the end of the propriety and appeared quite and by then it was very late so we took it. The second night an annoying loud sound started to pound our ears and went on and on for the entire night, leaving us with no sleep. At check in and on ours reservation, we asked for a quite room and that is what we got. No room upgrade was offered. Disappointed for the price-value of this resort. This hotel is old and not the place for business and professional people. If you are an old timer or a college student on spring break and want to be right on the beach, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Bus Trip to Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: Tina P
Reviews.Content: There were 44 of us on this bus trip from Ship-n-Shore, Sarasota, Fl. We arrived in Jacksonville and boarded the "Lady St. John" for a 2 hr. cruise and buffet luncheon along the St. John 's River. We then proceeded to Daytona Beach where we all checked into the"Perry'sOcean-Edge Resort and beachfront hotel. Had a dine-in kitchen suite and ocean view! Enjoyed a BBQ at the Tiki Bar for dinner and the rest of the night was at leisure. Very Clean Rooms! We all (4 of us) swam in the in door pool! We boarded the next morning and headed for Blue Springs State Park, the largest park on the St. John 's River. Designated to Manatee Refuge. It was a 2 hr. cruise and lots of wildlife! Then we went to "Deleon Springs State Park" and lunch was included at "The Old Spanish Sugar Mill" where we were flipping our our flapjacks right at our own table with a built- in grill! What Fun ! And the Pancakes were absolutely delicious! You choose a meat entree, then a raw egg, blueberries and pancake batter to cook on your own grill! Superb!!! What a great Trip! I bought the pancake mix and Pure Maple Syrup to bring home to serve to my Son and Daughter-in-law that were due to visit us that coming week! Oh My!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Second time...not sure if there will be a third.”
Reviews.Author: ILoveVacation4
Reviews.Content: Perry's has a GREAT location. The view from the rooms are beautiful. Our room lacked in the cleanliness department and it had a funky smell. The property is definately dated, but the location makes up for it. They do offer free doughnuts each morning which is nice. It was very quiet this time, but we stayed here in March two years ago, and spring breakers were everywhere. If you are a family be careful of this. Overall, the location is great, but the whole property has seen better days.

Reviews.Title: “UPDATE REVIEW FOR THE YUPPIES WHO ONLY WANT NEW!”
Reviews.Author: whopper65
Reviews.Content: I noticed in some of the reviews that the individuals were disappointed that Perry's was not one of those new, modern, antiseptic properties. Yes, Perry's is an older property, so any one who reads this review and wants an ultramodern newer facility, DON'T COME TO PERRY'S! However, if you want an ultraclean, ultrafriendly, traveler friendly place to enjoy your vacation, no matter how short or long, please give Perry's a try. You'll be more than happy that you did. One of my favorite stories when I first went to Perry's about 20 years ago - I had my first introduction to bocce ball. When I saw those elderly gents and ladies, some of whom were actually in walkers, I almost felt sorry for them - until they cleaned my clock! Competitive bocce ball is a rude awakening for the novice. But I eventually learned their strategies and have grown to love the game. In fact, now that I live in Nevada, i actually run the bocce ball program at the local parks & rec facility. But I regress - back to Perry's. The staff is very friendly, the organized games and activities are family and senior friendly, the free coffee and donuts are top-notch, and the indoor pool and hot tub are refreshing. Shuffleboard courts and two outdoor pools add to the quality of your vacation. Unlike most hotels/motels, you will make new friends if you take part in the daily activities. And many of the seniors have been coming back for years and years. Says something for the joint, right??? Did I mention that Perry's is also reasonable, close to a supermarket if you want to eat in occasionally (nice kitchenette), a fairly close drive to many local eateries (don't miss Aunt Catfish's), and very roomy with two queen beds and a foldout sofa. The balconies make for a fantastic end of the day as the sun is setting on the ocean, and windows on both ends of the room make for incredible fresh breezes. Again, for those of you who are only concerned with newer facilities, don't come to Perry's and then complain about it. Perry's, although an older property has been thoroughly maintained and ultraclean. The room service is friendly and thorough. All in all, not only a great value for the money, but a more enjoyable and relaxing stay than almost any other hotel in Daytona Beach. We tried the (supposed) best and keep coming back to Perry's where they really do treat you like family!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service!”
Reviews.Author: horodgramma
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check-out, our stay could not have been better. We were traveling throughout Florida celebrating our 50th wedding anniversary, and found Perry's on Cheap Tickets.com. So glad we did. Great prices, great room, great amenities- they have it all. The staff handled any concerns immediately. We will be back. Willy and Jan, Burrillville,RI

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfortable, great location”
Reviews.Author: John36758
Reviews.Content: My with and I enjoyed our 3 day stay here. The vacation equipped room was clean, comfortable. It had two queen beds, dinning table, equipped vacation kitchen. We could see and hear the ocean when we sat on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place”
Reviews.Author: IndygirlSmithfield
Reviews.Content: What a jewel. Great location, price and amenities! Can't wait to tell others about it and return with the entire family. Hated to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only Hotel I stay at.”
Reviews.Author: froggy522
Reviews.Content: My family loves, loves loves Perrys. This is the only place we stay when we go to Daytona. Everyone is awesome. I have never had one complaint with anyone or anything at Perrys, it is simply the best place ever. and the home made donuts are the best. Marion H

Reviews.Title: “Always a favorite!”
Reviews.Author: FlowerShopDaisy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here since I was a kid & love it. It's not the faciest place but it's a great value for an oceanfront hotel w/ and indoor pool (hard to find in here in FL). The rooms are clean, they have small or large kitchenettes, there is shuffleboard, a little putting green & a tiki hut. It's my favorite beach stop esp. in winter. This is the first time I've eaten at the diner in the parking lot & I was impressed. It was really cute, really clean & really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “A weekend of renewal”
Reviews.Author: bappleton
Reviews.Content: I have always enjoyed Perry's, and this weekend was no different. What Perry's has to offer is off the top to say the least.. All of Perry's staff says hello in passing and is willing to help, answer questions or just chat. They truly make you feel like you are priority. My only dislike is, I hate the strictness of the 10 PM Pool "get out" time, but I understand the need for it. Cant wait to come back for summer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: horsebaby
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this place alot. The rooms are older but extremely clean and a very kind staff. We used the indoor pool and hot tub daily and it was always in perfect order. The beach is right outside the doors and had great access. They had two nice outdoor pools but we did not use them while we were there but they looked very nice also.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: Robert S
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I stayed at Perry's for 10 days in Nov. 2011. On our arrival, we learned we had been upgraded to an oceanfront room. View was terrific.It is an older property but very clean. Staff was very nice, maid service was efficient (we put the make up our room sign out and on our return it was always done). We enjoyed the free coffee and donuts each morning with special note to the man who oversees it (coffee was better than most restaurants).We would definitely reccomend Perry's and we plan to return in near future.

Reviews.Title: “Florida's Family, Friendly, Fun Resort”
Reviews.Author: Travelone_intl
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing we visited this place in their off season this year - Our family was referred to this resort from the "Weber family" of Hamilton, Ohio that visits the property more frequently. Our stay was amazing because it was a dream come true from their sub tropical theme heated indoor pool with Daytona's Largest hot tub. The resort also features two outdoor pools, a mini golf, tiki bar and family entertainment schedule by the hotel and operated by their staff. Our room was large and roomy and really clean with two double beds. Everyone was friendly from the time we checked in with their front desk staff to their housekeepers and everyone who made out stay more enjoyable. My favorite part of our stay was their complementary breakfast every morning with homemade donuts like the white icing with sprinkles on top, chocolate topside and their fabulous coconut icing donuts. Hot coffee, fresh squeeze OJ and morning newspaper was also free and awaiting me every morning for breakfast. This is really a beautiful resort to visit any season - their staff is always aiming to please and made us feel so welcome. I truly recommend this place and will return Soon. Thanks, Casey Family

Reviews.Title: “GREAT AFFORDABLE FAMILY & SENIOR RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: whopper65
Reviews.Content: Located on the beach near the middle of everything, Perry's is the ultimate family and senior friendly mini or long-stay vacation spot. Great value for oceanfront suites with cooking facilities. Real-life room for 6 in spacious mini-suites, many times during the winter months we could open the windows on each end to get an incredible breeze from the ocean. However, the best part of Perry's is the friendliness of the staff, the organized family and senior games and activities, and the immaculate grounds. Mini putt-putt, shuffleboard, and bocce courts are always being utilized. The indoor heated pool and hot-tub are in addition to the outdoor pools and, of course, the great beach right outside of your room! While at Perry's don't forget to ask the staff for great reasonably priced restaurants ranging from semi-formal to distinctly casual. Aunt Catfish's is a must, just observe all the locals once you're there. Short drive from Perry's.

Reviews.Title: “PET FRIENDLY!”
Reviews.Author: goodtogo777
Reviews.Content: It tough to find a descent place to beach side with your best friend but Perrys White Caps is the answer It's not perfect but it's very nice and if you stay a month or more the rate is cheap they've got an indoor heated pool what a pleasure our 2nd year there. Make Sure You Clean Up after Fluffy so you don't give the other pooches a bad rap!!! It's a nice family destination

Reviews.Title: “Cottages”
Reviews.Author: Patricia L
Reviews.Content: The cottages were pet friendly and we really rejoyed the view every morning and night. Service was great. Very private for people that was to be alone. We will return fron another visit. Easy access to the ocean and lots of places to visit close. Really loved my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Still in love with Perry's!”
Reviews.Author: pcbcla
Reviews.Content: My extended family and I have been going to Perry's for about thirteen years and have always enjoyed our stay. My husband and I were traveling alone to Daytona and decided to stay in one of the White Caps cottages because we were traveling with our dogs (both terriers). We had stopped at Perry's to check on a pet friendly room the last time we were in Daytona (last March) and were told that two dogs were no problem at White Caps (Perry's adjacent sister property), and the pet fee would be $25.00 per dog for the entire stay. We ended up staying somewhere else but knowing that the two dogs wouldn't be a problem, I made the reservation for our stay in October. Upon checking in, I was given a pet policy that stated that only one dog was allowed per room and the weight limit was 20 pounds when we had previously been told it was 25 pounds. I don't know if the pet policy changed between March and October or we were misinformed, but since we had just traveled 21 hours by car, we took a chance and stayed with our two dogs (one 19 pounds and the other 25). Our dogs are crate trained and very obedient and we took them with us when we left the property except when we were at the beach (no dogs allowed on the beach) and then we crated them. We noticed later that there were other people with dogs even larger than ours in the cottages so we felt better about sliding under the radar. As always, the staff was friendly (especially housekeeping) and the cottage was clean and comfortable. Sure, they're a little worn, but they are an older style as are the motel rooms that are part of White Caps. The rooms at Perry's are a little nicer but it's great to have a seperate cottage, especially when you are traveling with a pet (or pets!). We made use of the kitchen and the grills outside the cottages by purchasing fresh seafood at King's Seafood Market and some sides at the Winn Dixie across the street. All in all, another great stay at Perry's in spite of the mixup with the pet policy.

Reviews.Title: “Our third group vacation at Perry's”
Reviews.Author: Peggy C
Reviews.Content: We booked 10 rooms, all Oceanfront, on the golf package. The resort is clean, modern, and had more amenities than we could use. There is one disabled person in our group, and she had a wonderful time in the beautiful indoor pool. Lisa had everything ready for us, including use of the "donut" room for games and fun in the evening. The course, The Golf Club at Cypress Head, was absolutely beautiful. They too had our carts ready, along with the voucher from the hotel. We will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Looking for Hotel for Daytona Beach, Must Inside pool!!!”
Reviews.Author: boat33
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the Beach, Rooms have updated with small kitchen. Only 3 Star with out side corridors. Check the New indoor pool as well outside pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation at Perry's Ocean Resort ( Daytona Beach ) 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jerry J
Reviews.Content: Hi, travelers, I'd like to share my experience with you's about Perry's Ocean Resort, My family stayed here from August 21st to the August 28th, Our stay was super First, we had room 607# Oceanfront, this had a eat in kitchen, that over looked our pool, beach and ocean, Beautiful sun sets,coming up, Staff were also super, as they were their always for your needs, They'd actually give you a print out map, if you needed to go somewhere, and you won't get lost, The maid service was also great, at your door every morning at App: 10:00 , Our room was very spacious, and spotless, shopping was a walk across the street food, beverages etc. Homemade donuts on the 2nd flr, was also great for the kids, got them out of bed every morning >lol Oh ya, I also like to mention, their beds were very comfortable, you were a sleep before you knew it. If I had to rate Perry's out of 5 >>> I'd have to give them a 5/5, That's how much we enjoyed our trip, Last, I can't forget to mention their pools, 3 of them, to out side, over looking the beach and ocean, and 1 inside, with a jaguzzi beside, That was dad's favorite, So travelers, if your thinking of a great stay in Daytona Beach, believe me, Perry's Ocean Resort is for you, We're definetly going back to Perry's Jerry & Shireen Jordan & our boys Toronto Ontario Canada

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Sophiebronx
Reviews.Content: Was there for a meeting the room was very clean, the front desk staff, had everything right the minute I walked in. Loved everything about my stay, will most definitely be back to stay there. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel we will be back”
Reviews.Author: snowmyst1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the north tower as the rooms are larger. Room was large, had good beds and furniture. Maid service was efficient and timely, not to early or late. Grounds were very well maintained and looked lovely. Pools well kept clean. They have activities for young and old but we didn't take advantage of them. Fresh homemade donuts every morning was a bonus! We will go back next year and bring all the grandkids, they will have a blast!

Reviews.Title: “Great golf package”
Reviews.Author: OcalaDuo
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at Perry's several times and I have to admit that I can't understand some of the bad reviews. It's as if they are staying at a different place. We keep going back because we think it's the best place in Daytona !! Sure there are some that have more glitz but we go to the beach for the "beach" . Almost all of the rooms have an ocean view and even if you stay at one of the rooms that doesn't -- there are plenty of chairs out on the lawn that give you a wonderful ocean view -- don't forget the "Tiki Bar" and there is a restaurant. I have to admit the restaurant used to open at 7am - now it's 8. That didn't work for our early tee times ( there are numerous great golf courses nearby and Perry's golf package will make all the arrangements for you). So, we went to the IHOP just across the street for breakfast. Don't forget people --- you are at the beach...Things do get damp and mildew is a problem but if you've ever lived in coastal Florida - you would know that. AND even the high priced glitzy hotels ( Hilton, etc) have mildew .. I know because we used to stay there until we found Perry's. The pools are cleaned every day -- there have been a few times that we've seen "unruly" kids throwing things in the pool and generally being a pain in the neck to everyone trying to have fun -- but that's the fault of their parents -- the hotel can't folllow everyone around 24 hours a day a pick up after them.. All in all -- the best place to stay...

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: adamel
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here on our way home from Disney World for some much needed rest!! The staff was wonderful, rooms very clean, and there was plenty for the kids to do. We enjoyed the swimming pools and great beach location! We are already looking forward to next years vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Budget Getaway”
Reviews.Author: zilla21
Reviews.Content: After a long winter in Northern New York a short vacation to Florida was a perfect relief. All we wanted was clean, inexpensive and on the beach. The accomodations included a kitchenette, which provided even more ability to watch our budget. There is a Publix almost directly across the street which enabled us to purchase food for breakfast, snacks and lunch. We have local friends in Daytona who took us to some lovely restaurants in surrounding areas. The hotel delivered all that we wanted included the beach at our doorstep every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Overall we loved Perry's”
Reviews.Author: Shelemiah
Reviews.Content: We wanted to visit Daytona Beach Shores since some friends were up there and just needed 1 night so we booked a rate of over $100 that we normally would not have, especially for a 3 star hotel in a run of the house room. However, when we arrived all we did is ask nicely if there was a chance of being upgraded and they put us in a bigger, oceanfront room with a little kitchenette. We were very pleased about this. The room was warm when we arrived, but we figured it was because the air had been turned up for a while. After all, the management didn't expect to use it. We turned it way down (the fan would not blow on high) to get it cool and headed for the beach. When we returned it was cool enough for lounging but still a bit too warm for 4 people getting ready to go out for a nice dinner since the bathroom end of the room was not cooling down and there was no fan for venting the humidity. Note: We did NOT leave the door open to the balcony, so this wasn't a factor. In fairness to the management, however, we did not report this as we didn't realize until the next day, when we were getting ready to actually check out that it was indeed a faulty unit and not our hurried preparations that were causing the warm room (411). The beds are full size (we like queens) but they were comfortable enough. Tip to management: extra pillows on each bed would be a plus. There was a nice table for 6 in the case that you would want to save $$ on meals and eat in the room. The bathroom is small and the whole thing is in need of remodeling. I also noticed a bit of an odor in the room. There were also some night time noises that I cannot explain that must have been from the adjoining room (our party was not using). I'm pretty picky but none of these negative comments would keep me from returning because of the benefits to the grounds! Perry's has 3 pools! Practically ON the beach, it has a putting green next to this pool and in between a grassy area with nice round tables with umbrellas, chairs and GRILLS! This is a very fun family hotel!! Family reunions would be a total blast here!! They also have shuffle board, an indoor pool and hot tub and another outdoor pool that I didn't see. The beach here is drive on so you can load up your car and find an entrance drive to the beach if needed but it's really a nice place right there at the hotel. The beach is what we Floridians call sugar sand. It's very soft and brushes off easily after it's dry. The water is clearer the farther south you go but these waves are very consistant for surfers! BRING BINOCULARS because in the AM when the water is glassy you can see dolphin fin for a mile out if you have a good eye or binocs. I saw shapes (it was almost to the horizon) coming way up out of the water and splashes that had to be a school of dolphin in the AM while watching my kids surf from the grassy "patio" area. I also watched one dolphin completely clear the water not 10 ft. in front of my son while he was trying to catch a wave. There are rental places that rent 4 wheelers, chairs and umbrellas and the hotel has a tiki bar for burgers and even omelets! Between 7AM and 10AM they serve homemade donuts (all you can eat), OJ and coffee in the breakfast room on the second floor of the main building. It thought the donuts were really wonderful! If we had paid over $100 for a small room facing the indoor pool I would think the price unfair, but we were upgraded to an oceanFRONT room so I was very pleased with our stay, just wish I had not to fight the heat to get dressed to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Family Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Chadton
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was exciting; check-in and check-out; the room; the view; the beach; the donuts; icecream on beach; swimming pools were great; surrounding restaurants and attractions; everything was super clean; and staff were all friendly and accomodating. The price was unbelievably affordable. We plan to return !!!

Reviews.Title: “If you are seeking peace and quiet look somewhere else......”
Reviews.Author: foodadvisor074
Reviews.Content: My family and I are long time Perry's customers. We traveled a long distance to vacation there this year. Before you plan to arrive make sure you check to see if any youth groups are staying at this hotel. A large church group (convention in town and will be booked every year until 2013) arrived and teenagers were booked in surrounding rooms. They came and went and would leave in the evening returning around 11:15 p.m. and would yell down the hallways and slam doors until 12:30 a.m. or 1:00 a.m. Needless to say it was a very disappointing trip as we went for rest and relaxation. I thought the policy was no teenagers left unsupervised. There were 4 teenagers booked per room and they were very loud. Also there was senior citizens staying in and around some of these rooms and they disturbed them as well. I opened the door and saw one guest walking down the corrider asking if they had been beating on our floor. He said that he was going to find out who was doing it. If we ever travel to Daytona again we will check to see what activity is going on at the Oceans Center and make other arrangements for vacation if youth groups are in town. My family had to travel back home to get some rest.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible, hated it, never again”
Reviews.Author: 1Bodie3
Reviews.Content: Terrible room with glass imbedded in the carpet, mattresses that were lousy. Groups of kids staying there as a youth group which meant lots of them and not a lot of adults. Malfunctioning fire alarm. Someone through soup from a balcony onto our car and no one cared at front desk. Comforters and blankets on bed were torn and ragged. For the price we paid, we could have stayed in better rooms in other hotels with a better view. Complete ripoff! Don't go there. We used to stay at Perry's with my parents for more than 20 years. Things have really gone downhill.

Reviews.Title: “Planning our next visit”
Reviews.Author: MSmom2three
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights on a trip to see the last shuttle launch. When we arrived, we were given a free room upgrade. We had reserved just a regular room with no ocean view. We were given a room with 2 queen beds, sleeper sofa and a full kitchen with table. The bathroom was big and there was a walk-in closet. The room was spotless and huge. As we were the last room at the end, we had a clear view of the ocean. There was so much to do. There were 2 outside pools with kiddie pools and an indoor pool and hot tub. They were all clean. There were shuffle boards, grills and tables all just steps from the beach. We didn't have any problems with noise.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: AreWeThereYet3_11
Reviews.Content: Good location and close to shopping. Rooms clean but carpets need updating. Rooms have a musty smell. Quiet and some rooms have great ocean views. Rooms large, kitchens are a plus. Beds comfortable and bathrooms clean. Great indoor pool but it can get crowded at times.

Reviews.Title: “Find another place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Beatarmy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights. First night was fine. Ocean front view was great. 2nd night was a problem. Lots of noise. The room above us sounded as though they were having a tag team wrestling match. The room next to us had teens beating on the door. And when i say beating i mean beating. If you want peace and quiet find another place

Reviews.Title: “Will only frustrate you, do not stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Mininova
Reviews.Content: We came here on our honeymoon and got a great deal from hod. When we arrived we could not find parking at first. We got lucky and got a spot near our room, buy since then it has been a nightmare. There are not enough parking spaces for the rooms they have. You end up in a shady parking lot across the street when there is nothing else available. You have to drive around forever and hope no one steals the spot you just saw open up. There are Mosquitos in the inside pool area. The outside pool is pretty dirty and the beach isn't much better right behind the hotel. Doughnuts are enjoyed by everyone here and seems to be the biggest plus to this hotel....they still aren't as great as krispy kreme. They do however have a wide variety of flavors. First room we were put in wasn't great, it smelled. Second room was much better with a king bed, not double beds like the first. The parking has put quite a damper in our experience the most. If you do stay, be sure to get back to the hotel early on or you will be walking.

Reviews.Title: “It's not what it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Perry's over many years. Last year we felt they were headed back to the "good-ole-days" with great staff and better kept grounds. This year it was again a disappointment. When we first stayed at Perry's it was a AAA 4* resort and we fell in love..this was back in 1985, I believe. Now we struggled to find clean or unbroken chairs to sit by the pools. The indoor pool was closed the end of our stay..I don't know why. They will NEVER let you check in minute early. We went to Disney and they let us check in 3 hours early. Perrys said the room was not ready but no cleaning staff were near any rooms at that time. I wouldn't have said this but it has happened before to us. It is a beautiful setting and with 3 pools could be the preimer resort if they could up their standards. We left feeling like we may never return to our favorite spot. If you have more than 1 car with you the second has to park across the street which isn't even right across the street and you pay $10 for that!

Reviews.Title: “mommy of little ones review :)”
Reviews.Author: m0mmy3b0ys
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before i booked this hotel and wished that a mom traveling with little ones would have gave some insider information so i vowed to do it myself! We stayed at Perrys from Friday may 27 to Monday may 30 (memorial day weekend 2011) We really wanted a hotel room where we had some seperation from our 3 children (age 6,4,1). We booked a south tower ocean front kids suite. The rate was higher (179 a night ) but it was a pretty good value due to holiday weekend and features of room. First of all when we checked in at 330 the staff was friendly and quick to get us through the check in process . We were given a map and our keys and we headed up to our room (201) We we first got in our room WOW the view was AMAZING! Second the room was nicely designed , updated, everything worked and it was IMMACULATE! I am super OCD about my kids and my baby eating off the floors but this place was 5 second rule worthy all day long! We reserved a crib and it wasnt in the room when we got there but they brought it to us a few minutes after i called down to the front desk( it was actully a pack n play) and it too was super clean :) . The kids had there own room with bunk beds , tv, little size table and chairs and draws it was a good size and still had room for crib! Only thing missing was a door :( . Outside beach was steps away , outside pool was clean , big and towels were always stocked ( impressed for such a busy weekend!) kiddle pool was a hit with my little ones! Indoor pool was HUGE and the websites photos DO NOT do it justice! Hot tub was great. Garden around pool was nice and gave a relaxing feel. Hotel was super busy and parking lot was a little crowded but when we shut our door We could not hear a thing , it was suprizingly QUIET! And we were right by the stairs too so i thought we were going to hear people running up and down all night but we slept like babys! Donut lounge is an added Tasty bonus and the housekeeping staff is AWESOME , really all the staff was friendly and very helpful , they pointed us in the right direction several times as this is a large resort! Winn dixie, IHOP and 7-11 are a walk across the road . All in All we loved it and we will be repeat customers! Oh and kittenette is fully stocked with dishes,glasses, silverware,cutting boards, cups toaster and more!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we would have stayed here”
Reviews.Author: TrinaFifeLake
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. What attracted me was the webcam from the hotel, so I looked into this place. I wanted to stay here at least one night (give the kids the "staying right on the ocean" experience) during our vacation. The staff were very nice and I got a good rate/we just walked in because we weren't sure which night to stay. I had a oceanfront room. The room was very nice/clean and spacious. The grounds were very nice. The kids liked shuffelboard and basketball. The tiki bar was pretty cool however, it closed very early. Pools were nice and clean. Plenty of outdoor furniture for guests. All around it was a very nice place to stay and next time we visit florida, we are staying here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Friday and Saturday AFTERNOON lawn karaoke is a DISGRACE to a resort that bills itself as "home".”
Reviews.Author: 40YearsOfExperience
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Perry's for 40 of my 43 years. Four generations of my family have inhabited these grounds for a vacation. This year we arrived on a Saturday night, paid for an ocean front room overlooking their beautiful lawn and were forcibly treated to one of the most pathetic, loud and obnoxious karaoke performances I've ever heard. When you attend karaoke, you normally go to an establishment where that is what you expect. The money you pay to be there normally purchases drinks and food, with which the karaoke at minimum doesn't interfere. At Perry's, you pay for a family-friendly ocean-front room expecting to hear the sound of the ocean. But you don't get it on a Friday or Saturday afternoon from 3pm to 8pm. I personally observed families gathering up their children and taking them away from the lawn where I played with my grandpa and grandma - the pool where I learned to swim. All to get away from a combination of foul language, bad country, bad rock, bad rap, bad hip hop and bad pop being spewed upon a few vacationers who I guarantee booked their rooms with other plans. Perry's, you should be ashamed. Mr. Perry would be.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: teamwife1
Reviews.Content: we stay at Perry's at least 4 to 5 times a year. we love it. all amenities are available at all times. our friends and family would recommend this place to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice staff but Perry's has a noise problem.”
Reviews.Author: haleyscomet389
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Perry's for nine days with Mom, Dad, younger sister. My parents booked two rooms that joined so we had enough personal space. Our first impression was very positive, the staff was very nice and greeted you every time they saw you. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Both rooms had two full kitchens, a dining table, two queen size beds, and balconies with an ocean front view. The maids were always at your room very early which my family found very convienent. Perry's also offers free donuts, coffee, and orange juice everyday starting at 7am. Perry's is also right across the street from IHOP and Winn Dixie. My family had stayed in hotels up the beach more and we found that it was just too crowded. Perry's is a little further down the beach and we found that the beach had a comfortable amount of people. It rained one day that we were at the beach and we decided to go to the indoor pool which was very clean. I only noticed a few minor issues at Perry's and the biggest one was the noise problem. In the bathroom above the toilet there is a small widow with a screen that lets ALL the noise in. I closed the screen and the bathroom door and my sister and I could still hear everythng going on outside.We also noticed that there are some areas of Perry's that aren't very clean. The elevator and stairs were definatly not clean. The fitness room was a let down but it was fine because I had an entire beach to run on! Overall, my entire family enjoyed staying at Perry's and I would recommend it to a family traveling with children.

Reviews.Title: “nightmare”
Reviews.Author: keely1029
Reviews.Content: we picked this motel so our 4 lbs maltese could come with us. The policy said dogs under 20 lbs. There was a great dane and a pit bull mix in one cottage. These two dogs frequently were allowed to run free. Second a woman came with two small dogs who ran everypplace and the owner was no where to be found at times. These two small dogs attached me dog 3 times. The woman refused to put them on leashes. When I contact the manager I got no response. A second person contacted the manager again still no response. Finally my husband went to the manager office. After another 30 minuntes he comes and ask the lady to put her dog on leashes. She refused. We contacted the manager again and got no response so we packed up and left. As we were leaving the manager finally gave her rope to tie her dogs up.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay There~”
Reviews.Author: steck1959
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 1st Anniversary by making reservations for Perry’s. We checked in and got a room that smelled very badly. I walked down to the front desk, only to be told they were booked. However, they could bring a machine in to suck all the air out of the room (along with the bad smell) but that we could not use the room for at least an hour. We decided to walk across the street and get Lysol and a candle. We stayed for two nights, the smell came back the first night, so we kept the candle lit the second night, all night long . . that seemed to help ~ Oh, and we found a pair of gloves on the closet floor….. it’s been quite awhile since we’ve needed gloves here in Florida. I’m just wondering how long they had been in the closet. Does/did anyone really clean the room? We checked out on Sunday. When we arrived back home, I unpacked my clothes and forgot a pair of shorts and two t-shirts that were in the second drawer of the dresser. I immediately called only to be told that housekeeping was gone for the day and to call back at 10:00 on Monday. I did. They told me they didn’t find anything. That wasn’t good enough for me. I called back again, this time asking for a manager. I talked to the manger who said that house keeping had a bag, but they couldn’t find it and that the house keeper for that room had the day off. She later called me back to confirm that the bag was not from my room… Hum, can I just say…. 1. I did indeed leave my stuff in the 2nd drawer. 2. Why didn’t the housekeeper find it after cleaning the room, if they do indeed clean room? 3. Where did my stuff go? 4. Oh, yeah, one of the shirts is a Coors Light halter top with lace on the back…. it’s one of a kind, since I made it…. so if anyone ever sees that shirt…. well, it’s mine!! 5. We will NEVER go back to Perry’s again!

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled, basketball court broken up cement and hoop nonexistent”
Reviews.Author: joeman55
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons I booked here is that my young son wanted a basketball hoop/court to play on during our stay....The basketball hoop was broken cement covered with weeds and the basketball hoop was barely hangin on a pole and the rim was non existent...what a joke. The sidewalks were covered with old gum and stuck to them.. the whole property was about a number 5 out of 10 on the cleanllness scale...in there defense...nice location on the beach...but my expectations where not met...and when i brought up the basketball disrepair...all I got were blank stares....the last time I will stay here

Reviews.Title: “Very handicap friendly!”
Reviews.Author: RuthyS
Reviews.Content: we visited the last week of February. My husband was attending a convention held at the Ocean Center & hosted by another hotel. As it was also our 20th anniversary, we decided to book the oceanfront Jacuzzi suite in the north tower. Perry's even provided the champagne - a "romance package" still in affect from Valentine's day. We loved it. Can't imagine a better view on the entire strip. Not only do you get the view from your balcony but in the jacuzzi suites you have an entire wall of windows on one side of the tub. All you have to do is open the shutters & there is the ocean. Everything everyone else has said is right on the money. HOWEVER, you have to realize that this is a LARGE place and it was hit by the hurricane last year. So, not every room is renovated yet. There IS a parking garage with several levels but it seems everyone wants to park right at the doors. I am in a wheelchair. My van will not fit in the parking garage (too tall) and I need room to get my chair out. That's why handicap spots are so wide & long. Yet, every night, we found every handicap spot taken by those who did not have handicap plates or placards. One night I went in to tell management & she sent maintenance around to the offenders rooms immediately. Overall, Perry's really should let people know how handicap friendly their place is. Walkways from building to building are ramped - no steps. There is a ramp down to the indoor pool. They even have a automatic transfer seat for those in wheelchairs to get in & out of the pool! I didn't explore the back "lawn area" too much as it was winter & I had no use for the outdoor pools or tiki bar. But I did manage to ride off the walk way & on to the grass & recline my chair to lay in the sun when it was 86 degrees our last day there. There was plenty of room to maneuver my chair in the office, public areas, elevators & in my room (which is actually one of the smallest rooms they have). Bathroom, however was tiny. I could not take my chair in there. Luckily I can still take a few steps without it. Anyone with a cane, walker or rollator should be fine though. So, don't be afraid to bring grandma & grandpa along with the rest of the family. They will get along just fine. Oh, almost forgot - Daytona Beach offers free use of beach wheelchairs at the life guard stations so if your chair will not go in sand, you don't want to get sand all over yours OR you just have a hard time walking on sand there is no need to worry about that either. They will even deliver the beach wheelchairs if you need them to.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest advertising”
Reviews.Author: kdolson
Reviews.Content: The hotel's on-line advertised "Best of House" rate is a farse. It states that they will give you the best room available upon arrival. At check-in, they put us in a street level room in a corner almost under the parking lot and furthest from any ocean view. When inquiring about a better room, there were rooms available, but were $50 extra per night! The clerk stated that the room we were in was a "Best of House" room. Their advertising was completely dishonest. The room itself seemed okay, but we found an ocean-front room at a different hotel for the same price and checked out immediately. The manager was incredibly rude and even stated "You can't expect us to give you the best room for that rate!" Well, yes I can if that what you're advertising states.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Accomodating”
Reviews.Author: SunnyFarmReb
Reviews.Content: Perry's Ocean Edge Resort is a family-oriented place a few blocks away from the main action of Daytona Beach's strip. The rooms are clean, bright, and comfortable. We were upgraded to an oceanfront efficiency as soon as we arrived. The grounds are lovely with plenty of chairs, umbrellas, and greenspace. Doughnuts are served every morning, and there is an IHOP and Winn Dixie directly across the street. I would certainly recommend this place to anyone who intends to vacation in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a very nice resort!”
Reviews.Author: pattipoop56
Reviews.Content: I wasat this resort this weekend w/son and family, very clean and loved the fact that it was a family place. The beach was a little chilly so the children enjoyed the inside pool. The pool was very much accomadating to lots of poeple and I liked that they had tables and chairs sitting over the grounds instead just by the pool. I will go back again and I will let my friends and family know about Perry's. Thanks again P.S. The donuts were yummy!

Reviews.Title: “Fun and pleasant, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: 30Flowers30
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Daytona before, and chose this hotel based on online pictures and reviews. As many others have written, it's not exactly a 5-star place and needs a bit of updating, but I think you'd have to be rather picky to not be satisfied here. I thought the mattresses were comfy, and the resort kitchen in the room was great--stocked with everything we needed to make most of our food, which saved a lot of money. Also, there's a grocery store across the street as well as an IHOP, and a few surf-shop type places within easy walking distance, as well as a pretty extravagant looking mini-golf place. There is a bus stop right outside the hotel that will take you up and down Atlantic Ave., all the way to the lighthouse at Ponce Inlet and the Marine Science Center, both of which are worth the trip and have pretty cheap admission. My friend and I found the buses to be clean, cheap, generally on time, and easy to navigate--handy, since we didn't have a car. The fresh-made donuts were delicious and came with coffee, tea, and orange juice. The outdoor pool/courtyard area would have been lovely if the weather hadn't been cold while we were there. The indoor pool and hot tub area was quite nice, though. Not quite as big as it looked online, but very clean and pleasant with lots of towels and pretty plants. Best by far was the location on the beach. We had a balcony overlooking the ocean, and nothing beats getting up each morning and watching the sun rise over the Atlantic. We also had a great view of brown pelicans diving into the ocean for food, which I thought was ridiculously cool.

Reviews.Title: “Great price for a ocean front hotel with in door pool.”
Reviews.Author: SteveS1
Reviews.Content: We like staying on the beach without paying a lot. For $89 tax included and coffee and doughnut in the morning it seemed too cheap. But we got a oceanfront room with a balcony that was clean and comfortable. The grounds and outdoor pools were lovely and Daytona Beach great to walk on. Due to the cool weather the indoor pool was most welcome.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful beech view”
Reviews.Author: chockhead
Reviews.Content: This is a very Good Motel.Clean rooms and towels.A view of the Beech 2 die for,The free Doughnuts and coffe are very good first thing in the morrning,The Hot Tub and swimming pool are wonderful.Will Go Back.

Reviews.Title: “Perry's Ocean Edge Resort”
Reviews.Author: GemCityOH
Reviews.Content: I got what I expected. From reading other reviews I knew Perry's needed some updating and it does. However I found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. Atrium pool area looks a little nicer online than it actually is, but we enjoyed it. I chose this hotel for 2 reasons, beachfront and budget. The beach is right out the backdoor, and I feel I got what I paid for. I found all of the staff to be friendly and helpful. Upon arrival I noticed the toilet in our room wouldn't flush. I called the front desk who immediately had maintenance up to fix it. They had a new supply line on the toilet faster than I could change into my swimming trunks. The homemade donuts are as good as everybody says, and the parking is as bad.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: essmac
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying here, but have to admit I was disappointed in the end. Got in around 10pm-ish, out of Orlando from a west coast flight. Checked in with a reservation on a Sunday night (staying 3 nights for an event an hour away). At first, they were going to put me into a street level room in the parking lot, but I complained that I had a reservation for 3 nights. Why would they stick a female traveller on a street level room when they were clearly not full – and had better rooms on the ocean front? Do they not want me to recommend my stay to anyone else? Because I complained, they moved me. On the way to the room I noticed the elevator was dirty. Hand prints all over the doors and the floor needed new linoleum (those hand prints were there for the duration of my stay). The room had a nice view with balcony, but the carpet felt damp. I guess this is due to the general mugginess of Florida and the fact the hotel is on the ocean. Use of the room safe was an additional $5. There was a 7-11 and Winn-Dixie across the street, but I have to admit, at night both places had a general Daytona Beach sketchiness. Is there another reason I may not be aware of, that people hang out in the parking lot? No restaurant on site. On the plus side, the hotel is on the beach, so you just step off the property and you've got a good ten-mile stretch. Pool looks inviting on a sunny day. Parking is free. I did not see any bugs and did not leave with any bites. You're not in central Daytona Beach, so it is quieter (not that November was particularly busy anywhere). The Best Western is right next door, so you can eat at a reasonable price. Come to think of it, that hotel may be a better choice. I know I've provided an upside to the hotel – pool, parking, no bugs – but I would not stay here again due to my experience checking in, damp floors and general sketchiness of the area.

Reviews.Title: “IT WAS A NICE GET AWAY!”
Reviews.Author: armydriver
