Reviews.Content: It was a nice quiet place for this time of year. right now they have a stay 2 nights get 1 night free special. every little bit helps. rooms were clean. most if not all rooms have a kitchen. so you dont have to eat out all the time. all utensils and dishes included for 4 people. its right on the beach! what more can you ask for. they do have 416 rooms. so at busier times. things could get a little crowed. theres in indoor pool and spa in a rather large atrium. i had this conversation with them. its a spa not a jacuzzi. so the jets are rather weak. its hot though. so that could diappoint. overall it was nice, quiet and relaxing! for the winter months. some thing worth checking out! dont froget the free home made donuts each morning!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: 4gapeach
Reviews.Content: Perry's is showing a little age, but it was clean and the staff was helpful. We did try the doughnuts and they were good, but we like a little more protein for breakfast so we ate at the little place next door, Wild Bills I think, very good! Great beach location, a little short on parking..

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary getaway”
Reviews.Author: Oldvet081
Reviews.Content: Since our five children are scattered coast to coast, it is difficult to bring them all together at one time. My wife and I have made Perrys our hotel of choice for some of our recent anniversary celebrations; just the two of us . . . most recently our 65th! Dinner at a nice restaurant and return to sip a nice champagne on the balcony while watching / listening to the waves. The location is convenient, family oriented, not noisy, the rooms are clean and the staff always friendly. . . . . and the price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL FOR THE PRICE”
Reviews.Author: HeidiandIngrid
Reviews.Content: We have never been to Perry's or Daytona Beach before. I found Perry's by looking through the reviews of Daytona Beach hotels. This was a sister's getaway and we had the best time. The hotel and room were clean, indoor pool area was beautiful and pool was extremely warm. The outdoor pools were a little to cool for October 9-12, 2010. The beach was fantastic. It was convenient that the bus stop was directly in front of the hotel. We did not notice any bugs and the beds were soft and comfortable. This was a great hotel for the great price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: cgnblue
Reviews.Content: My family and extended family has been staying at Perry's for many many years. Many of the rooms have recently been remodeled and are quite spacious and comfortable. After checking into our room we noticed that it smelled of cig. smoke and requested to move our room. The front desk was very accomidating and upgraded us to a much larger room with a full kitchen at no charge. The hotel is great for families with children of all ages as they offer many daily activities. The donuts are made every morning and are to die for! Overall I have never had a bad experience in all the years I visited.

Reviews.Title: “it was a very pleasant and incredible surprise”
Reviews.Author: Rinaldo38
Reviews.Content: When i booked this hotel it had average reviews. I checked in september 4,2010 and was smooth as ice. I was in my room within 10 minutes. The room was an ocean view with a balcony and full kitchenette. First off the room was very very clean. The kitchen and utensils and appliances were incredibly spotless. The view was to die for. The front desk employees were always helpful and polite with smiling faces. The donuts that are free every morning are fantastic as per other reviews about this hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “everyone and everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: truckersteve1041
Reviews.Content: from check in to departure was great we needed a baby crib and did not tell them till we arrived and by the time we checked in and got to the room it was there it was just like the pictures in the travel guide and on the web site the rooms were large in the north tower the view was great the room was perfect the pools were clean the tiki bar was good and not crowed on the beach THANKS FOR MAKING THIS A GREAT LONG WEEKEND and looking forward to returning for the next visit .... steve p.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Retro Hotel on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: haztaz69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 days and 4 nights at Perry's. We met family there so we had four ground level rooms in the south tower facing the beach. After reading the reviews we didn't know what to expect. It was a great location right on the beach with an indoor and an outdoor pool. The decor is retro 60's style. However our room was nice, clean, and comfortable. No mold or mildew. Coffee and donuts every morning were a nice touch. Grocery store and IHOP across the street so we could stock up on beer, wine, and snacks for the efficiency kitchen in the room. In the past we stayed at the Bahama House, which is newer and nicer. However, it didn't have the direct walkout access to the beach like Perry's. We'd recommend Perry's for a fun family vacation right on the beach. If your looking for new, modern, upscale hotels go stay at the Hyatt. We usualy stay in 4 or 5 star hotels when we travel. However, Perry's was fun and nice enough for our needs on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “all good”
Reviews.Author: buzzwells
Reviews.Content: Check in a breeze, room view exceptional, condition good. homemade donuts were a nice touch, however staff needs to keep it cleaner and selection gets limited as time goes by.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for Mold & Mildew look no further then Perrys OceanEdge Resort....”
Reviews.Author: tinakruse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from what was supposed to be a relaxing vacation in Daytona Beach Florida... We stayed at Perrys OceanEdge Resort. We stayed in the south tower on the 4th fl. The view from the roon was Beautiful, the Ocean and the sun rise and the moon over the ocean was amazing, but thats all that was great about this trip... The room we stayed in had mold on the ceiling above the bed where we slept. The smell in the room was of mildew, I still can't get that smell out of my nose. Even our clothes smelled from mold and mildew when we returned home. The carpet was filthy and I would not put my bare feet on it. Also very noisey from people coming and going all night long... Pool was Disgusting.... If you want to be in the 60;s or 70;s then stay here..... Needs to be up-dated....

Reviews.Title: “PERRY'S A GREAT PLACE FOR A BEACH VACATION!!”
Reviews.Author: lions61
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of nicest, friendlyest,cleanest resort/hotels on Daytona Beach. It is an older property that is very well maintained. It's spread out over a large area of beach, not a tall hi rise like so many of the newer resorts.There are two outdoor pools that are clean and well maintained. Around the pools are beautifully landscaped lawns with plenty of lounge chairs so there is alot of space for everyone to enjoy the pool area and beach front! unlike the newer resorts.The rooms are large and very clean! Most with private balconies, and great views of pools and the beach. Also pool area has a nice tiki bar. There is also a beautiful indoor pool with a huge hot tub in a beautiful atrium. It is located at the south end of the beach which is more family oriented than the north end of the beach.Overall one of the nicset places I have ever stayed at on Daytona Beach and I have stayed at many, Just a great place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perry's is still "it".”
Reviews.Author: aturner108
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Perry's for 50 years, have introduced our children and grandchildren to it now. Our visit was fine, however, we did have a few complaints. No air conditioning in the lounge, towels very thin and lounge chairs were never wiped off. I'm sure these things will be corrected in time for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: malak003
Reviews.Content: very noisey, pool chairs broken, dirty. one star .high priced. no safety . poor management .donot book hot wire resaon,they gave you the bottom of the room ,than when you get there if you donot like you must up grade like i did it cost me over two x much still was not worth it .I got hurt by the pool they didnot do anything about it.never will I stay there again poor poor sevice.dirty no air.ec................no high speed inter neet.no good gym.old two thing poor ad.

Reviews.Title: “7TH Year at Perry's---dissapppinted this year!!”
Reviews.Author: PleaseTakeMe2
Reviews.Content: This year was our 7th year vacationing at Perry's. Although we enjoyed the aminities, especially the heated indoor pool/hot tub and fast elevators down to the beach, I was MAJORLY DISSAPPOINTED with the room this time. First, we had difficulty opening the door to the room, and then we couldn't get out of the room until my husband used some serious "Hulk" force on the door. Once outside the room again, we couldn't close the door, which delayed us from the beach. We eventually called the front desk and they sent a maintenance guy--who arrived fairly quickly and readjusted hinges/replaced door parts. Worked fine after that, but our neighbors, who apparently had the same door issues must not have called for repair because we listened to them slamming their doors open/shut our entire stay. The thing that most dissappointed me was the pigeon poop on the oceanfront balcony. I could deal with the old, wooden porch charis, but not the massive amounts of pigeon poop that was all along the railing of the balcony, under the chairs and heaped in the corner (I'm uploading photos). At night, at least 10-15 pigeons nested in the corner of our balcony and made noise. Had I known that the "free upgrade" to a 6th floor room with a full kitchen would cause me to lose the use of the oceanfront balcony that I paid $138/night for, I would have declined the upgrade. We couldn't sit on the balcony the entire trip, let alone put our beach towels out there to dry! Stay away from those 6th floor rooms----Poop Palace!!! As has been our usual experience, our bathroom was clean--no mildew anywhere & the linens were clean and the pillows were fluffy. Staff is friendly enough--we were always greeted nicely. However, the room itself had a mildew smell that I believe was caused by the old, dirty, damp carpet. Also, under the beds could use a thorough cleaning - vacuuming out. My daughter's sippy cup fell and rolled under the bed. I was so grossed out that I didn't bother to wash/scald the cup, we just tossed it in the trash and bought a new one. Our television required a few presses to get it to turn on---it would spontaneously turn off. Maid service was rather slow and the language barrier was a challenge when requesting items that she forgot to replinish. Parking can be a nightmare after dinner time, so plan to use the overflow lot across the street (very dark and unsecured). Best to use the north tower's parking deck (more visible from the hotel & lighted) , if you can find a spot--park on the top floor ------it's just a short walk down to the indoor pool area to access the south tower suites. We will consider staying again next year, but I compiled names of a few newer hotels that we passed by in the area & I will be researching those on this web site for value/cleanliness. I'd still recommend Perry's to family/friends, but I'd certainly advise them to avoid the 6th floor "pigeon poop" balcony rooms, to avoid contact with the carpet---other than your shoes, and to check under the beds.

Reviews.Title: “Definately a hidden deal in the area.”
Reviews.Author: rtn690
Reviews.Content: Perry's is an older resort, but is generally well kept and clean. The rooms are large and have amenities such as fridges, stoves, cooking utensils and such. A great value for the price. The Tiki Bar is fantastic and the other resort activities are also good. The beach access is absolutely beautiful! The resort has great cabins that are huge and pet friendly. Our only glitch was an a/c unit that conked out, but the maintenance staff had it fixed in a couple of hours with no problem. A great excuse to hit the beach. If you don't need a lot of upscale amenities and want a great value, this is the place. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “We loved Perry's”
Reviews.Author: dotsonbryant
Reviews.Content: This is a great place for a family to stay. There are three pools, with one heated indoors. My kids loved this pool. The view of the ocean is great, at least from the north tower rooms. Our room was large with a kitchen, dining area, couch, and two queen beds. It was very clean, and the beds were firm and comfortable. Also, the doughnuts were delicious. They are free in the dining room, or $3.00 a dozen to go. Winn-Dixie is straight across the street. They plan activities for the kids (although we didn't do them). No loud noise while we were there either.

Reviews.Title: “perrys, you never dissipoint”
Reviews.Author: daytonabeachLover
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from Perry's and every time I come home happy. I like change and like to try new hotels but it seems we always end up at the south tower front door at perrys ocean edge resort on Daytona Beach. Let me start with the room, we got a week in the south tower oceanfront suite and it was beautiful. It had a full kichen with two chairs, a booth and a table in the kichen. Then two nice beds and a pullout couch. the balcony was very nicely furnished and perfect for a sunrise shot. the out side was fantastic. how many hotels actually have a lawn, a pool with stone deck, shuffle board, a tiki hut ,another outdoor pool and over 20 lusious palm trees. Most hotels are just paved over by concrete or stone, take your pick but trust me Perry's is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Close to perfect Perry's”
Reviews.Author: Popsbrew
Reviews.Content: Spacious deep beach, 3 pools, 2 outside w baby pool, 1 inside heated w hot tub, schuffle board, puting green, Tiki bar, coffee, juice & doughnuts breakfast, rooms spacious and clean, South tower rooms computer connections a little cumbersome, located within walking distance of a 7/11. Winn-Dixie & Congo Putt-putt golf

Reviews.Title: “I cant wait to go bak to perry's !! Best location on the beach !”
Reviews.Author: oklates
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for a week, after reading the reviews it was better than i expected! The rooms were very clean, housekeeping kept up with them everyday. The beds were great, the view from the first floor was wonderful, our room was the perfect location between all the pools and the Tiki Bar. I totally miss Tiki Bill :) We went up and down the beach on a golf cart and did not see another attractive property like this one. Perry's literally had everything we were looking for. We had a total of 7 kids between the age of 8-16 with us, they were able to run the property, eat donuts everymorning, walk 10 steps to the beach and swim in the jacuzzi and awesome indoor pool. I recommend this hotel for so many reasons. Cant wait to go back! If i could change a few things it would be the outdoor pools should be heated they are so awesome and go to waste when its chilly. Also The Tiki grill and bar should be open later !!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good and the Bad at Perry's”
Reviews.Author: GoldenJudy
Reviews.Content: I carefully read all of the Trip Advisor comments before selecting a motel for our 3 day stay in Daytona. Because of my research, all of the wedding guests stayed at Perrys. Everyone agreed that Perry's was "very adequate". For $99 per night, no one left disgruntled although very tired from disruptive sleep. None of of us had high expectations. The motel definitely feels old. To use the words "newly remodeled" on their website, I am certain they added a fresh coat of pain and new bedspreads. The mis matched carpeting and orginal bathrooms certainly create an old feel to the room. I walked the beach for several miles in both directions and concluded that Perry's is one of the few motels that hasrooms with direct ocean front view. Most motels are built perpendicular to the ocean and the room face the building next door and/or their parking lot. Because Perry's faces the ocean, I rated the overall experience higher than I would have based on the quality of the room. There is a fine line between old and dirty. I didn't find anything glaringly dirty, but the dingy old tiles in the bathroom and the old formica didn't have a shiny, clean appearance (although I am sure it was clean). I am recommending this motel with hesitancy--to those who want a large ocean front room for a reasonable price--and keep your expectations low (it definitely is not a Westin, Hyatt or Four Seasons!) We drove 1 hour north to St. Augustine and enjoyed a trolley tour of the city. A great side trip. I wasn't impressed with Daytona--too many tee shirt shops, fried food and nothing to do other than hang out on the beach. Won't be returning to Daytona. The Good: Ocean front room Large Room refrigerator/microwave comfortable bed with no dips, firm mattress Easy free Parking Lots of outdoor chairs on ocean side Helpful, friendly staff at front desk across the street from Winn Dixie grocery store located away from congested park of hotel strip Free internet in lobby, could print out boarding pass for flight The Bad: Doors slam all night long--impossible to sleep through jarring noise Can hear noises through adjoining door Can hear voices along walkway outside of door Old, dirty elevators Lumpy, old pillows Poor quality reception on TV Fee to use in room safe unpleasant musty odor in bathroom scratchy, thin towels

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price!”
Reviews.Author: lmj62486
Reviews.Content: I was unsure about this place at first because of the mixed reviews. It ended up being wonderful for my boyfriend and I. We are in our early 20's and both enjoyed ourselves here. The lawn furniture was convienent so we didn't have to rent from the vendors down on the beach, the pools (inside and out) were clean. The donuts in the morning are delicious! There is a grocery store directly across the street. It is also located walking distance from a bar, put-put, and souviener store...A lilttle bit further away from downtown, but worked for wanting to stay away from the craziness of spring break. The rooms were clean, but the beds and pillows some help. Excellent value for what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable & friendly.”
Reviews.Author: brenpipe
Reviews.Content: We were extremely pleased with our stay. Although check in is 3:00pm, we were allowed to check in when we arrived at 1:00pm. We were greeted by a pleasant young man named Aaron. I was amazed at how CLEAN the room was. We had a courtyard view. The kitchen area had a stove & oven and full size refridgerator all utensils including a can opener and corkscrew. It was chilly during our stay so we didn't use the outdoor pools, but the setting was beautiful with lounge chairs, umbrella tables, etc. We did enjoy the indoor pool which was really warm and the hot spa pool. In the morning they provide home made donuts, coffee, tea & juice. I definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “This is the reason that we enjoy going to Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Methodical
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth time that my family and I have stayed at this hotel. We really enjoy coming here when we visit Daytona Beach. This trip my children enjoyed staying in their "Kids Suite". They thought that this was the coolest place ever. The motel is older so if you are expecting the RITZ, you won't get it. The beds and bathrooms are very clean. It is also nice to be able to cook in your room if you choose to. We can't wait to go back next year for a fun filled vacation. Perry's Edge, here we come! -New York

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: nosescott
Reviews.Content: This place is cool, funky, cute, clean... but old. It makes a Sheraton seem like a Four Seasons. But oddly, that's part of the charm. I was down for the race and really enjoyed the place... had a bit of the retro feel with the audacious colors. They have the indoor pool which I think would be cool for kids. Even the rooms indoors facing the pool were kinda goofy but cool. I had an oceanfront room and it was not bad. We paid $90 and while it wasn't even at a Westin or Sheraton level, it was well worth it. Go into with lowered expectations and you'll be fine. And that's not a bad thing. Beds were adequate, shower head sucks.... like really bad aerator-style... kitchenette was a nice bonus and the suite was big enough for two guys to not get in each other's way.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location and value”
Reviews.Author: summerb26
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel with a indoor pool and jacuzzi. Plus 2 outdoor pools with shuffle board and basketball court. Awesome beachfront location! A little off the beaten path but great if you have children of any ages. Rooms are older but full kitchens and huge bathrooms make up for it. Would stay here any time I was in Daytona!

Reviews.Title: “It depends on what you are use to”
Reviews.Author: NatesBestGirl
Reviews.Content: We live in Fl and wanted to find a place to take the kids swimming for the weekend. I did a search for hotels near Jacksonville that had an indoor pool. Well, Perry's popped up with pretty good reviews (moore good than bad) thhe price was not bad at all and the room had a room with bunkbeds for the kids with a t TV /fridge/microwave and stove and great ocean views. Well the short and sweet of if is...if you are used to 4 and 5 star resorts THIS IS NOT THE PLACE FOR YOU. My 5 year old even made coments about the stinky room. (our room smelled of wet dog) The over all room was nice, but again, not what we are use to. If you have a big family and are on a budget, this place is ok..it was clean and the bed linen seem ok, but I kept socks on everone. The pool was full of snow birds who were not very happy to see kids show up in the steaming hot pool. (when they said heated they were not joking) We went to the ocean and ran around and found shells...this would be a much better place in the summer I would think, but not a lot of fun for us this trip. We ate brunch at the Hilton down the street.....we will be staying at the Hilton next time we visit Daytona beach...BTW the Hilton has a 1/2 indoor 1/2 outdoor pool I found out a little too late.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view & great value”
Reviews.Author: Restatitsbest
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an older property, HOWEVER, it is very clean and the customer service is great. I was in an oceanfront room, with two beds, and a kitchen area. My room was nice and clean and the view of the ocean was fantastic!! I was on the 6th floor and during the day and some nights I left my balcony door open to hear the ocean waves crashing on the shore. I had a couple of issues with the locks on the doors, heat in the room, and my tv but maintenance responded IMMEDIATELY to my concerns. Great value!! Especially if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “OMG they charge you if you cancel within 3 days of booking full room cost”
Reviews.Author: Slodog
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many, many times previously and loved it. I would have given it a 4.5/5 stars. I recently booked 2 rooms to take my grandchildren and mother for a 3 day holiday. OMG when my mother became ill and I had to cancel they charged me for both rooms full price. I cancelled within 3 days of booking and over 8 weeks prior to our arrival. OMG Perry's what has happened to you???? I asked to speak to the manager and the RUDE young black man told me he was the manager and I would have to pay!!! Beware of this issue. We are devastated! We have filed a transaction dispute with our credit card but what a pain.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: FloridaTlc
Reviews.Content: I live locally but when I want to stay at the beach this is my place. The main attraction is the friendly staff and the indoor pool. The rooms are spacious and clean, with kitchen area. Nice views. The location is good, convenient restaurants and groceries. Wide beach, quiet at night. We usually don't swim in the ocean at this location, there are better places in Daytona area. Not the hotels fault!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Experience”
Reviews.Author: PeaceGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Myself and a couple of friends stayed at the hotel for 2 day, and the experience was excellent. The staff is friendly, helpful, and welcoming. There are 3 pools and 1 of the pools is a heated indoor which is great! Parking is free. The rooms are clean, comfortable, and neatly organized. We stayed in a ocean view room superb! Its located in a conviente area Winn-Dixie and Ihop directly across the street. Banks, Shopping and, souvenior shops within miles away. I would recommend anyone to stay at this hotel. No free breakfast though, but a superb experience made up for the none breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with great location and amenities”
Reviews.Author: SouthernHarley
Reviews.Content: We did not have reservations but thought we would give it a try. They did have vacancies and we were offered 3 rooms to choose from. Our room had a king size bed with a dining table and a nicely equipped kitchen area. The room was very clean and there was no mustiness or mold. The room was ground level with a small patio area and seating overlooking one of the outdoor pools. The view of the ocean was beautiful - we enjoyed our morning coffee on the patio. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our trip to Daytona was short but very nice.”
Reviews.Author: rnsurgery
Reviews.Content: Perry's Ocean Edge Resort was very nice. It is an older hotel but was very nice. Free freshly made donuts every morning. Nice rooms with ocean balcony a nice kitchenette. The only complaint that we had was that we called for more towels and they never came also the hose to rinse your feet before going into the pool was not working. If we go back to Daytona I will definately return here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rates-Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: phatfillTampa
Reviews.Content: Upon check in was upgraded to great room without asking-was given a room facing the indoor pool-it was very large, had a full kitchen, wonderful bed, was exceptionally clean and was sound proof. Home made donuts in the morning was a treat as was the ocean front bar. Indoor pool and hot tub were both very clean and the off season rate could not be better.

Reviews.Title: “WON'T HAVE TO DO THAT AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: summerjoe7
Reviews.Content: this was an old rundown hotel.they call it a resort.back view was okay. otherwise it was nasty towels were like sandpaper. parking was ridiculious. info said 24hour security, never saw that.parking was awful. people were rude.bought pkg from back to caribbean, don't recommend that.hotel worried us death over taxes on room - 24.00.also,don't go to fl sports & rec for presentation, rude, rude, rude and mean to people.everything around hotel was old and rundown.prostitutes on every corner

Reviews.Title: “Plan early and let Perrys know you are a returning/prior guests”
Reviews.Author: DavidS007
Reviews.Content: Our family of seven (4 adults & 3 kids under 12) traveled from Fl, Texas and VT to enjoy Daytona Beach. We rented two rooms in the North Tower from July 10th through July 14th. We have stayed at Perry's probably 10 - 12 times over the last dozen years. We almost always visit during the busy summer months so we can enjoy the ocean water and outdoor pools. We have NEVER needed to change rooms or had problems parking. Although parking does get tight during peak periods. During our most recent stay (second time in N. Tower) our room was ready when we checked in around 2:00. Room has two queen beds and a fold out couch large enough for two small kids. Room includes regular size fridge, stove, oven and plenty of dishes for each day . Bathroom stocked with towels, soaps and lotions. Second vanity area with it's own sink and large mirror help make the room feel spacious. BEST part is the awesome view from the room along with it's private balcony overlooking the outdoor pool and beautiful Daytona Beach. Our balcony included a couple of chairs and small table. Still had plenty of room for our large ice chest and water toys. Room was serviced each morning with fresh towels, soaps, lotions and all dirty dishes were cleaned and put away. Other family members in the second room (right above ours, as we requested) was just as clean and spacious as ours with the same positive feedback. HOMEMADE donuts with coffee and juice (about 6-9 each morning) will start your day on the right track. Add some fruit and maybe a cereal bar and your good to go until lunch. A grocery store is located right across the street. The Tiki bar serves good burgers, ribs and cool drinks. Gift shop on site carries the basics you will need at the beach, swim wear, sunglasses, water toys, etc..VERY convenient if you lose your sunglasses to the Altantic Ocean like I did. Check out went fine with no problem charges. A couple of "tips" we have learned over the years, hope they help: 1. LET PERRYS KNOW YOU ARE RETURNING GUEST - they appreciate loyalty. 2. Plan early and reserve early. 3. Be specific in your room request. The N. Tower rooms have been redone and are worth the extra few bucks. 4. Perry's has a FAMILY atmoshphere and not for honeymooners or romantic getaways. 5. Stay away from slow elevators. Suggest staying on second or third floors. Still great views. 6. Take advantage of FREE kids/adults activities. 7. Sit back, relax and enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Indoor Pool is Awful”
Reviews.Author: readingsully2
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Perry's for a few years now for a family reunion. I have always enjoyed it but this year I began to notice some changes: 1. My room in the North Tower at the price of $195.00 a night including taxes was a bit of let down. I do not think they are maintaining the place at the same level any more. First of all, I had a missing chair from my dining set. I was fed a line of bull the first time around. The second time around they scrounged around until the found me another chair. 2. The wood double seated chair on the balcony that has the table between was broken. The webbing was broken too and it was filthy with green mold. 3. The tub was not clean...there was hair in it when I got there and the trash can in the bathroom had not been emptied. 4. The elevator to the North Tower needs some serious work. It hesitates and is extremely slow. The stairwell stinks like someone urinated in there. It is just a shame because the concept of this place is wonderful. They are not keeping it up now. It is going down hill fast. The price for this place is not worth it anymore. 4. There was one ice tray in the fridge but they did send me two more. 5. What I am really mad about is the indoor pool. The chemicals were so strong that my 5 year old granddaughter broke out in a horrible rash with bumps. We had to seek out medication and two days later she still has the bumps. Also her skin is really dry and looks kind of white. Also, her hair was literally burnt. You could hear it crunch. She has such beautifully soft hair. The more I think about it the madder i get. In addition, the same thing happened to the 8 year daughter of my niece who was staying with in another room. Her rash came a day later. I noticed it was strong myself but never dreamed it would do this kind of damage to children. beau

Reviews.Title: “Lousy this time!”
Reviews.Author: Ohiovacationers01
Reviews.Content: This past June, we spent a week at Perry's with a total of 5 families. The first night we arrived at about 10:00pm after driving from Ohio straight thru the 2 rooms we wanted next to and connected to, wasn't going to happen. So one family had to stay in one room and move the next day. Finally got in our rooms about 11:00pm and the kids not happy. Two days later I get a call from my credit card company about charges to my room for each family. Turns out the front desk never asked for a method of payment from the other families. So, my card was charged for the whole week for 5 families. I had to spend time straightening this out. On the following Thursday my daughter stepped on a piece of glass in the hallway of the third floor. Went to the front desk to let them know this happened for cleanup. This piece was the size of a quarter, a nice size cut on the middle of her heel. The front desk never asked of her condition, if a doctor needed, nothing. When we left Saturday morning the blood was still on the hallway floor. So this was a lousy stay at Perry's.

Reviews.Title: “this place is disgusting !”
Reviews.Author: beachscene5
Reviews.Content: this was a hotel was a package deal we stayed in to go thru one of those buy in deals, we walked in the room and my eyes and sinuses instantly closed up from the urine smell, the mold and mildew on the ceilings and walls was gross, and the overall cleanliness was just disgusting. the pool area didnt look bad, but look at the dump they want you to sleep in before you sign in - obviously we went down the road after looking at 3 different rooms, and each one being just as gross as the last one. and the staff acted like they could care less. fitness center - lol - 5 broken down machines.

Reviews.Title: “Not for romance or for Parking !”
Reviews.Author: Amytony
Reviews.Content: Do not be fooled not all rooms have a private balcony like it advertises! Sure, this place would be awesome if you are going with your children, DO NOT PLAN A ROMANTIC GETAWAY! AWFUL AWFUL I MEAN HORRIBLE PARKING !!!!!! They let the kids hangout in the jacuzzi all day long, needless to say I dare not enter it come nitetime when there was no one around!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be!”
Reviews.Author: Linda S
Reviews.Content: Our family has been staying most vacations since 1986 at Perry's. It still has great grounds around the motel and an awesome indoor pool and great morning donuts. The problem for us is it has totally lost its personal care!! From reservations to check in to pool staff, no one is friendly or helpful. I get the feeling they are just "doing a job." When it was family owned we felt like we were 'coming home' each year. This will probably be our last trip there, there are so many great and newer motels on the beach! We had the rudest check in gal in the world. It just put such a damper on what was to be a pick-me-up after losing my Mom very recently. The whole place is just not as nice as it once was. Sorry........

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Dinatelo1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for time away. It was wonderful. We stayed in the Jacuzzi King Suite. It has a bunch of room and the view from our room was great. It was the best price that we could find for what we were looking for and it was a relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Push56
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Daytona at the end of Sept. Checked out several hotels on the beach, most of which were run down and over priced. Stayed at Perrys several years ago, so I called them and was promised a great rate for my 2 day stay. When we chcked in we were given our choice of almost any room in south tower. Room was very clean and in great shape. Nice Balcony great view, and we found out that it was right next door to the hotel we stayed on our honeymoon 32 years ago. Each morning we enjoyed the donuts, coffee, and juice. The staff was constantly cleaning and repairing the premises. Never saw such committment to quality. Indoor pool area was beautiful, and clean as were all the pools and lounging areas at the resort. My wife left her favorite shoes in the room when we checked out and the great staff mailed them to our home in PA. This is the only place I will stay when I go back to Daytona Beach

Reviews.Title: “decent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: UBTRU
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a decent place to stay. The rooms were clean, amenities were fair. I liked the beach booths that served ice cream and snacks out on the beach. I did not, however, like the cars/4 wheelers riding up and down the beach in the late afternoon. I have a toddler, and it just wasn't a relaxing experience to have to watch for cars constantly while your child trying to run on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: jdb01
Reviews.Content: Probably at some point in its existence was the place to stay. It is extremely clean and sand free for a beach front resort. The resort staff was very helpful and friendly during our stay. We had a kitchenette in our room and that made our stay easier. There is also free internet access. The suites were small as suites go but enough room for 6-8 people to visit. There was no real room to eat but an outside table and chair set took care of that. We had a suite in the garden area that overlooked the indoor pool. I is heated and well maintained. There is a unique handicap access to the pool. There is a Winn Dixie Grocery store across the street as well as an IHOP. If you come for the beach and beach activities, then this is a great place. There is not much else, but who goes to the beach for non-beach activities?

Reviews.Title: “Perry's was great for our family!!”
Reviews.Author: tvlmimi
Reviews.Content: Booked last fall for 3 nights over the July 4 weekend/race for a family celebration. Had 3 oceanfront rooms with balconies, all together with two connecting, on 5th floor of South Tower. Great family place. Clean rooms, well-equipped kitchens, grounds immaculate, nice staff, and easy access to the beach. Gorgeous views from our balcony, especially the sunrise! Loved the homemade donuts and coffee/juice in the mornings. We certainly would stay there again and apparently many families come each year as they were booking for 2009 at checkout.

Reviews.Title: “What's up with the cars, people?!”
Reviews.Author: Mlissy
Reviews.Content: Just got back. Read other folks' reviews and I've got to say that you people are really wound up in your cars. Parking is tight at many properties on the beach. Some of Perry's parking is certainly odd with their little garages. I think on holiday weekends they have a 1 car per room policy with additional cars per room required to park across the street in the overflow parking. I'm sure you'll manage. If you're there to hit the beach, then you won't be moving your car much anyway. Many families take advantage of the in-room kitchens and patio grills, leaving the property to get more groceries. We just walked across the street to get our munchies at the grocery, but then we only stayed the weekend. We saw lots of coolers and picnics going on in the patio area. Burgers on the grills smelled good. We ordered pizza and had it delivered near the pool area. Those pizza delivery folks were busy Saturday night, but we got our Stavros pizza in 20 minutes. They are just a block away. Several other reviews commented on the great staff. They have a lot of staff and they were all so nice and working hard. They even have people doing activities for kids, games, bingo, etc. My kids loved the shuffleboard. Note that you can get a gate key for beach access to use before you check in if your room isn't ready yet. It's great to head straight to the hotel in the morning and enjoy the beach for the day even before getting into your room.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Coke08
Reviews.Content: The rooms were okay and clean. Over all the entire resort could use a new paint job with more modern colors. The property is very clean. Parking is a problem that needs consideration. Vans and SUV's can make it in and out in the parking ramp if you can make a 30 point turn. The beach is not accessable from the resort at all for persons with disabilites. You have to drive to a ramp to get there with a wheel chair. How hard would it be to put in a ramp.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place for the Family”
Reviews.Author: ndpmom1999
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an oceanfront room at Perry's. We were in room 316. which I do reccommend. The view of the ocean is amazing as well as a beautiful view of the whole resort itself. The homemade donuts in the morning are wonderful. We could not wait until breakfast the next morning. The rooms are clean, a little dated. The facility is family friendly. There is an idoor pool as well and the trees and landscaping are beautiful around it. The indoor hot tub is really nice and very hot! Just what we had been hoping for! We loved the property. There is St Augustine grass all around the property and not all sand. We will be going back to Perry's again this summer. This is a really nice place. The only disadvantage to the whole experience was the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: TimWendy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Perry's just after the Memorial weekend, It was fantastic, We also stayed in motels in Orlando, and Clearwater Beach, and all 4 of our family rated Perry's their favorite. Service was top notch, facilities were top notch, couldn't have asked for better. Had excellent ocean front room on the 5th floor, in the north tower , enjoyed the grass area beetween hotel and beach, the shuffleboard was fun, along with other yard games available. Nice beach area, not to crowded, just right for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Simply one of the best on daytona shores”
Reviews.Author: RIB_Binghamton
Reviews.Content: I come to this hotel during my honeymoon. It is much better than I expected. Excellent customer service and fast response. Indeed, I traveled all around the world and this place is among the fastest to respond ever. i called for a battery for my remote control and they brought it to me within 2 minutes. I called for additional towels and I received them right after I hanged up. - I booked my room directly through them, which turned out to be a great thing. I was looking through Travelocity, Expedia, and Orbitz. Then I called the hotel to ask about amenities. I told them the best rate I got through Travelocity, and they immediately gave me a lower rate. the other advantages are (1) that I didn't have to pay more than one day in advance and the rest is when I check out which is better than travelocity which asks for the whole amount in advance, (2) that they gave me a king-bed room which was not available through Travelocity because the hotel has only few of these. - The check-in is as easy as it gets. -I booked oceanfront room and it was awesome. -The free internet access is convenient. -They have free donuts in the morning until 10 am. We ate there when we were not super hungry and we went to Denny's down the street when we were hungry. - It is located in a nice part of Daytona beach, not very crowded bot not deserted either. - We enjoyed the swimming pools which were always clean and warm. - There is a nice grocery store across the street and an awesome ice cream place two blocks further. It was probably the best ice cream I have ever had. - I will definitely stay here again! - My only complaint is the small parking lot. It gets crowded in the weekend but it is ok during the week. They have another parking lot across the street, but it is inconvenient to cross the street every time.

Reviews.Title: “Better options out there, beware”
Reviews.Author: buckeyes08
Reviews.Content: I researched my vacation through tripadvisor and saw this place is ranked pretty high and is not terribly expensive.I had spent a good deal of money on the first 5 nights in Daytona on a nice hotel and wanted to save a few bucks for the final 2 nights, so I choose this place. Let me start off by saying its right on the beach, and there is a Winn Dixie grocery right across the street. (I prefer the Publix right down the road). Which is nice But the room I had was an absolute dump, I stayed in the rooms overlooking the indoor pools. I've read other reviews that described renovated rooms, NOT this one. The room stunk, my neighbors were incredibly loud and the air conditioner blew either extemely cold leaving the room an ice box or extremley warm, no in between. And the staff in my opinion seemed very rude and clear they hated their jobs. Stay clear of this place, if you have small kids and are on a budget it may be worth it, but if your younger couples STAY AWAY, there are many other options on the shoreline that our much cheaper, learn from my mistakes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Consumerwise
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Daytona Beach and a friend recommended this hotel on the ocean. Checked out other reviews and decided to make a reservation. The check-in was smooth- very friendly and professional and we got exactly the room we reserved over the internet that was located in their south tower. It was beautifully decorated and had a balcony facing the ocean. Internet connection was great. It had outside and inside pools, and easy access to the beach. It's a mile or so from the Main St. pier, but not far from the Crabby Joe's pier. Beds were extremely comfortable. You could even see the ocean view from the bathroom! I'd recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings...Depends what room you get”
Reviews.Author: wasame
Reviews.Content: Well, I should preface by saying that the room we stayed in was not one of the ocean front rooms which are renovated and more up to date...we stayed in a room facing the indoor pool/atrium. Our room while clean is not 3 star, its more like 2 or 2.5 star. Its out of date. When we first walked into the room, I immediately felt a sense of regret. We could have upgraded for a fee but just decided to just stay in the same room. I did get the opportunity to look into the ocean front rooms...they are much nicer. The north tower rooms have flat panel tvs and are bigger than the south tower rooms but otherwise both towers are equally up to date and clean. The front exterior of the hotel, hallways, and atrium area are all dated although maintained and clean- I would say they appear more like a 2 star hotel. On the other hand, the outdoor pool areas and the ocean front rooms deserve the hotel's 3 star rating. So, I would say if you are used to 3 or 4 star hotels/resorts and/or your home is up to date and you are used to that kind of environment, be sure that you choose an oceanfront room or else you wont be happy at this hotel. The good: ocean front rooms are up to date, outdoor pool areas very nice, Winn Dixie across the street, my kids liked the indoor pool, family atmosphere, if you're in to donuts they have free ones in the morning along with coffee and OJ, they have lots of friendly warm staff- all employees were great, there was plenty of sunning chairs on the grass and pool areas, The bad: no coffee in the room (I had a kitchen with utensils, a coffee pot, etc but no coffee), atrium rooms are out of date, hotel is out of date other than the ocean front rooms and outdoor pools, the fitness room is scary looking, the pool towels (located only in the indoor pool area by the way)are so small!! they are like hand towels and are rough, each person had to take 2 towels to dry off and the garbage can filled with new towels kept running out of towels. I think if I had stayed in an oceanfront room this review would be different. But then again I would have payed alot more so I dont know if I would have felt it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time!”
Reviews.Author: Leaffan14
Reviews.Content: My whole family (12) of us stayed in 4 rooms. 3 joined together so it felt like a huge suite. This was an excellent family resort. It is getting a bit dated, and seems to be a little pricey, but all in all it was a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: sandybeach27
Reviews.Content: The rooms and property were very clean. The staff was very pleasant and helpful! The only thing is if you have asthma or are sensitive to strong smells then you need to ask that they not spray the orange deoderizer! They were very helpful and brought in a room ionizer to clean the air since my child has asthma and it worked wonderful! We loved staying and we will stay again next time!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in room 108 south tower!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunlovengirl
Reviews.Content: Room 108 is the worst room in this hotel, We booked 2 dbl. beds ocean front suite and got a king bed with a kids room( no kids with us mind you) we were told it was a really nice room at the front desk well guess what they lied cause it was horrible, you looked out your window and saw a white cement wall! The parking lot lights from the hotel next door shinned in your room all night, you could not even see the ocean unless you went outside and looked to the left, for the price there are much nicer hotels in Daytona to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: earthlover73
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay...great for families, very clean, renovated, redecorated, nice kitchenettes and views. Great managment and staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! This was a perrrrfect vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaggieBuntyKarrena
Reviews.Content: Hello all, We stayed @ Perry's for 11 days in the North Tower 4th floor rm 424 nice and center in the resort - full kitchen 2 queen beds 1 full bathroom and another vanity area near the closet, and great AC. You really get what you pay for $130 & 135 for weekends. Excellent oceanfront view, exceptional maid service and friendly staff. The indoor heated pool was amazing and our 17 month old daughter loved it. The hot tub was sweet!! Nice flat HD TV. Grocery store right in front of the resort also down the road about 2-3 km another nicer grocery store called Publix good stores - BEALLS, Dots and lots of souvienir stores. They serve donuts, coffee, and OJ in the morning in the south tower but u have to eat them in the lounge. Everyday was gorgous weather we were truly lucky also I felt extra safe having the lifeguard tower so close to the resort. Only saw 1 jelly fish on the beach and saw many beautiful dolphins so close to the shore. If you like nice and quiet choose this resort. Maggie :)

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic, Fun Place to be..”
Reviews.Author: britbrat1
Reviews.Content: This trip made our 3rd visit to Perry's. As always it was great. The room was exceptionally clean. It was a standard oceanfront room on the second floor overlooking the pool and ocean. The check-in went very well and so did the check-out. The rooms seem to be alittle bigger than the average hotel rooms with a nice dining area, kitchen and bath. We had a balcony which was nice to relax on overlooking the Atlantic. The hotel was quiet at night. We used the outdoor pool facilities. It was clean and nice. They offer donuts for breakfast in a nice area on the second floor with a big screen tv, plenty of tables or if you choose, an outdoor patio. We look forward to our next trip there. We love that place!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beachfront Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HoustonTraveler_7
Reviews.Content: Our family, including two teen-age boys, really enjoyed our week at Perry's Ocean Edge Resort in Daytona Beach Shores. Our North Tower efficiency room was very spacious, with a fully equipped kitchen, sleeper sofa, two queen beds, extra sink/mirror/counter area, and balcony with beautiful beach view. The resort has a large lawn area, with two outdoor swimming pools, shuffleboard courts and many lounge chairs, tables and umbrellas. The beach is a few steps away. I felt very comfortable relaxing in a lounge chair on the lawn while the boys played on the beach, as there was a clear view and it was close. We were able to leave our stuff (towels, books, snacks, etc.) on the table on Perry's lawn while we played in the surf. There is also a lifeguard on the beach during daylight hours. In addition to the outdoor pools, the boys enjoyed the large indoor pool. Housekeeping and grounds maintenance was great - our room was thoroughly cleaned daily, and the grounds were very well kept - no litter, everything in working order. This hotel is several miles south of the center of Daytona Beach, but there are restaurants, grocery store, putt-putt places, etc. close by. There were not many planned activities the week we were there - a few craft classes and a pool activity - but it was a late summer week. Perhaps they do more during busier times. The only other possible complaint was that the guest coin laundries are small, not convenient, and seemed old. Overall, it was a great place for a relaxing week for the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: andon
Reviews.Content: We were staying a little ways down the beach and had some issues with our hotel about the cleanliness. Because my family and I had always stayed at Perry's when I was young my husband and I decided to see if they had any vacancies, we were excited that they did and it was actually cheaper than where we were. We moved in the next day for a week. We also decided to extend our trip an extra day our room was available but by the time I called the airline and rental car company our room had been booked, so they found us another room(even nicer) and all we had to do was pack our stuff and leave it by the door and they called our cell when our new room was ready and moved our stuff for us, they even moved the stuff in the fridge. I have never stayed somewhere that the staff cleans as much as Perry's they were even sweeping the parking lot. I can't wait till next year, Another thing that I liked we have a 14 yr old and an 11 yr old and I felt comfortable with them running around the hotel back and forth from the outdoor pool to the indoor and the hottub. A very family friendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Like a trusted friend”
Reviews.Author: beardogmom
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Perry' three other visits over the past 20 years and have never been dissappointed. It is not the fanciest place I ever stayed - but, probably one of the cleanest and dependable. Front desk staff always friendly and helpful. Maids do a good job; but, the grounds keepers are always busy keeping the place look so good and clean - lawns are well manicured. Nice to be able to lay on the grass right by the pool and beach. Great location - across the street from Food Lion. The homemade donuts in the morning are nice - but, probably not so nice for the body! Inside pool and spa nice. Two outdoor pools to pick from too. Tiki bar made a good drink - I was pregnant - so I had a virgin. The elevators are a little slow - but, always clean. Cute little gift shop on location as well.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! A family vacation must!”
Reviews.Author: hlgccbirds
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I did not want to leave. My sister has been going to Perry's for years, so this year we decided to try it. The stay was very relaxing. The ocean view rooms were large, with a pull out sofa bed. It had a fully functional kitchen, with a large fridge, and plenty of utensils, everything from a spatula to a corkscrew. We saved tons of money by stocking up the fridge for breakfast, and lunch meals, we decided to eat out each night. There are two large pools, and the biggest selling point was the indoor pool, which came in handy with our famous afternoon Florida storms. By the indoor pool was a large hot tub, which helped in the relaxation department. I fully recommend this hotel in all aspects! Enjoy tour stay at Perry's, and I am sure you will write your own glowing review!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Military, so you never know where.
Reviews.Title: “A Military Families Heaven.”
Reviews.Author: obeskured
Reviews.Content: I loved it. Me and my family have been going to Perry's for many years as a end of the school year treat for all of the kids. I took my husband there last year to show him before he left for basic training, and he plans to come back and stay as soon as he gets home from Iraq. Definitely choose Perry's to stay. Everything is always clean, the employee's are always helpful, and it's right next to everything that you could want. The sunrises are amazing. It's a getaway trip you never want to come home from.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Vacation - Best Donuts Ever!”
Reviews.Author: vacationmomOhio
Reviews.Content: I have been vacationing at Perry's Ocean Edge since I was six years old and I am now an adult with my own family. My grandparents found this resort long ago and the wonderful atmosphere and pleasing accommodations have only gotten better with time! My husband and I have been glad to escape to Florida with our two children (ages 10 and 4) three times in the past three years and we would never leave Perry's out of a trip to the sunshine state. Our entire family loves this hotel and its staff. Two wonderful outdoor pools, a beautiful indoor pool and hot tub area and many other family friendly touches are just some of the things to mention. Also, Perry's has redone most of their rooms recently and added Kids Beach Suites - so nice - with a separate room for the kids with bunk beds, their own t.v. and a view of the ocean!! What more could a family want! The rooms are very spacious and kept extremely clean. Don't miss the fabulous homemade donuts each morning - I am always so sad to have to leave Perry's and the donuts behind and come back to reality. You will not be disappointed with a stay at Perry's Ocean Edge!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Family Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: WorldScout
Reviews.Content: What a great find! A family-run, reasonably-price, family-friendly beach resort. Stumbled across this place on the internet when looking for a place to spend three days on the beach in Florida in March when we got good price on flights in Daytona Beach. Was sold on the idea of a room that opens right onto the indoor pool, plus amenities such as outdoor pools, beach front access, volleyball, shuffle board, putting green, boccie ball, etc. We were not disappointed. Had a second floor room with kitchen that opened onto a balcony overlooking indoor pool. Pool was warm and clean - son had a blast all day long in and out and up and down to room. Lots of lounge chairs around for adults to rest while kids have fun. Spa tub huge and hot - seems to be new. Outside activities free and accessible. Outside tiki bar small, but friendly and drink prices not outrageous. Found folks that had been coming back for 30+ years - some who had gotten married there and were coming back to celebrate. Some families that grew up going the Perry's and now bringing their kids back. Fresh, home-made donuts every morning. Laundry facilities on site. Restaurant on site for breakfast and lunch. Walking distance to local restaurants and a grocery store across the street. Free wi-fi access. Really did not dislike anything at all, except perhaps small, think towels in the bathrooms. But we could live with that! Have already booked for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome "Breakation"! ...We DIDNT want to leave. Clean Clean!!”
Reviews.Author: dantheman38
Reviews.Content: All My girlfriend and I can say is "what a place!". Awesome resort, clean clean clean! Sunrises a MUST SEE for the balcony EVERY morning. We took 600+ pics. I will post soon. EVERYTHING you need is at the resort - bar, restaurant (Eds Eatery - Awesome burgers for lunch), 3 pools - 1 indoors in an atrium setting with jacuzzi, ice cream socials, service EXCELLENT - talk to Vicky at frontdesk, Wynn Dixie grocery store across street, EVERYTHING within walking distance, Family owned and operated, maid service excellent!, view from beachfront balcony is truly spectacular!! All I can say is if you are looking to go to Daytona Beach?... go to Perry Ocean-Edge Resort for your stay!!... We didnt want to leave. thanks for reading... Dan Johnson and Karen Branam. Pennsylvania, USA.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: swnaugusta
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Perry's during Biketoberfest weekend. This was our first time at Perry's, and overall it was a great experience. This is an older hotel that's had a lot of upgrades and additions over the years. We found the staff friendly and helpful. The rooms were clean, and maid service was fine. I only had one complaint. The website said that rooms had hair dryers in them, and they did not. So I looked like Medusa all weekend. Which was actually ok because I was on the back of a motorcycle all weekend anyway. But if the website says they have it and they don't, well...... So pack a hair dryer if you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: tweets922
Reviews.Content: Myself, along with my son and his family and daughter and her family have been staying at Perrys for years. We have always found the employees to be polite and very helpful. The rooms are always clean and well supplied. No matter what age the child, there is something to do. They have family games, from building the best sandcastle to volleyball. There are plenty of chairs in which to lay out or sit. We live on the other coast, and this is just a few hours drive to a nice getaway with the entire family. We have found that most of the people who stay here are repeat customers who have come for years. It is convinent to grocery stores, one being across the street, and lots of entertainment. We were recommended by friends to stay here, and would recommend it highly to anyone looking for a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: LaRobley
Reviews.Content: Arrived on thursday pretty much had the whole place to ourselves. really enjoyed the pools and the room was really nice and big and it was super clean. And a very friendly staff. Will come back

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a vacation in Florida. We hadn't been to Florida in six years and imagine our surprise to see the great changes that had taken place at Perry's. We had wonderful accommodations. We had a great oceanfront room with kitchen. The outdoor pools and indoor pool were nice. We loved the friendly, family atmosphere. The staff members were extra nice. The free doughnuts and orange juice at breakfast were great, too. We highly recommend Perry's......We plan to stay there at our next vacation! Pat from KY

Reviews.Title: “Exellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Cah33511
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a few nights stay directly on the beach without having to spend a fortune and a travel agent recommended Perry's. For $100 a night we had a beautiful, clean newly remodeled room directly facing the ocean. Our room even had a small fridge with a microwave, great for those late night snacks. It was perfect! Perry's had much more than a perfect location to offer. There are 2 outdoor,(not including the children's pool) and 1 indoor pool with a large jacuzzi. They have a few planned activities for the kids to do for a nominal fee each day. Outside there are gas grills for barbecuing and shuffleboard for those people staying longer. The complimentary homemade doughnuts in the morning are a real treat as well. We had a great stay, and would not hesitate to go back again with our children since they would love it also.

Reviews.Title: “Perry's ocean edge updated and clean”
Reviews.Author: rockyroad2
Reviews.Content: just came back from Perry's Ocean Edge in Daytona Beach. It was clearly a standout in terms of clean room and having good pools, plenty chairs, and other fun things to do. Price was reasonable ($149) for deluxe oceanfront efficiency and the hotel staff very cordial.

HotelInfo.Name: Perry's Ocean Edge Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 2209 South Atlantic Ave., Daytona Beach, FL 32118
